description: My partner and I dined in at Haystack tonight for the first time. During the few minutes we waited for our table, at least 3 of the staff greeted and welcomed us. Service was altogether great with very friendly staff. We ordered a large pitcher of beer, antipasti salad, and a large Haystack pizza. All was very good, and they are generous on the toppings. We felt the pizza could have used more sauce, but will just ask for some extra on the side next time. Have I had better pizza? Yes. But I definitely enjoyed it and will be back. Pro tip: my partner and I are two big guys with equally large appetites, and had leftovers on the 16". Will order 14" next time.
author: Winston C.

description: The service is above excellent. The portions enormous, and the desserts beyond decadent. Ask for George as your waiter.
author: Lattigo P.

description: Nicest people in San Francisco! The people who work here treat you like member of their family. So incredibly welcoming and kind - plus good pizza and cute decor. Wholesome af.
author: Nic G.

description:
We ordered from Haystack Pizza while staying in Noe Valley. We used GrubHub and our pizza came quickly and tasted delicious! I especially appreciated that they weren't skimpy with the toppings. Don't you hate it when you order a mushroom pizza and you have exactly 9 mushroom slices on the entire pizza? Not at Haystack, they loaded it up! 

When I'm back in San Francisco, I hope to visit Haystack in person and try more of their menu!
author: Megan L.

description: Delicious Pizza and delicious dinners. I have never had a bad experience at this Noe Valley institution. Always trustworthy. Always delicious! Open late and friendly.
author: James J.

description:
This place gets 3 stars but that is a sum of very extreme ratings on a variety of topics.

4-5 stars: Value of italian dishes, especially the tortellini or anything eggplant. We never come home hungry. The meats in dishes and on pizza is usually good. Open pretty late. Great location. Sauce on pasta can be awesome sometimes, especially if you like thicker sauce. Speed of food coming out often is faster than the wait staff can bring it, and that is not due to just being microwaved. 

1-2 stars: Freshness of salad, pizza quality at times, slowness of wait staff at times (at best a 3 hence why we sit at the counter), wine selection not as big as most italian/pizza places in bay area. 

Definitely a solid option when used strategically as in certain items are extremely good value for San Francisco.
author: David A.

description:
This one of the very few establishment that is still on 24th street in Noe Valley that dates back to the time before gentrification.  Surprisingly they have several vegetarian special pizzas, as well as old school standards.
There deliver times are very inconsistent.  However I've rarely been disappointed with things I've ordered for pick up.  The few times I've eaten there,
The staff was been polite and attentive.
author: Sheila F.

description: I only recently discovered this cute noe valley pizzeria also has ravioli and other delicious pasta entrees. I've been ordering through their website (I can pay and tip online and pick it up on my way home from work) and it's always proper and ready and good. The owner is so well-dressed and charming and he always makes sure everything is perfect.
author: Christopher W.

description: A family fav always! Very picky eaters with an 16 and 11 year old. Once I call out haystack...Never a complaint. Always a pizza to go after our meal there.
author: Tony M.

description:
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city. Love the Ranch Chicken Sandwich, the Chicken Cordon Bleu is fantastic as are their pizzas and calzones. 
Whether ordering for delivery or eating in the folks at Haystack always give great customer service; they are sweet and helpful. 
Reminds me of pizza/pasta places back east where they serve delicious food from recipes that have existed for ages and you are treated like family when you arrive. 
I love this city for is unique and interesting foods, but when I want guarantee that I will enjoy every part of my meal, Haystack is always my top choice.
author: Tim W.

description: Great food and great customer service.  Pasta dishes and pizza are fantastic.  Cold beer on tap:) Thanks for the great time
author: Ryan E.

description: I used to visit Haystack years ago when I lived closer. I recently saw their menu online and remembered the Chicken Cacciatore I used to get there. It has disappeared from many Italian restaurant menus for some reason. We had it delivered and I swear it is better than I remembered! Absolutely the freshest richest sauce with tomatoes and olives served with aromatic rice and vegetable medley. The portion was huge! We also got a sausage & mushroom pizza and it too was fresh & tasty. Delivery was faster than promised. Highly recommended!
author: Mike O.

description: This was a staple of mine in Noe Valley. They had a delicious simple pizza and fun atmosphere for an after work unwind.
author: David M.

description: I am so sad that they have recently taken my most favorite sandwich, the chicken caprese, off of the menu.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Best pizza in the City. Hands down. As a native of the Mission--this gem is celebrated by all true locals & Gs all the way around. Dino, a sweet & knowledgeable man of Greek & Italian descent is the owner who orchestrated the menu of pizzas, pastas, steaks, lamb chops & more! Everything is fresh--made by scratch with his daily/weekly trips to the market. To prove its worth--Haystack will celebrate their 45th anniversary this year & remains the ONLY longstanding business in Noe Valley. I asked him how he's been able to maintain his success & he stated: 1) down-to-earth *good* food, 2) down-to-earth service, & 3) consistency.  Def check it out. You will leave with a satisfied belly of yumminess & a smile from the care of the staff.
author: Jacqueline R.

description: Sad to be nickled and dimed in a charming establishment like this. I just moved to the neighborhood with my partner and made nice with the staff and when ordering a burger, which is already expensive at $15, I was charged $1.50 for a side of ranch, which I find to be completely out of line and unacceptable. This meal was not at all worth over $16 and I even ordered it to go. I will likely skip out on returning here, which sucks because we live just around the corner.
author: Mahana B.

description: You know this place have it's high moments and low moments I go in order great delivery what's the deal wrong order bad timing shit and piss driver wham they want tips and credit for half hour short vigina mits meaning pizza place any who it's great as long as I'm driving cheers
author: Iz F.

description:
I love their pizza, calzones, entrees and service.
The epitome of a family run San Francisco business at its best.
author: michael h.

description: I had a pretty bad experience. Service took forever and when we went in to see how much longer it would take (after waiting for 45 minutes) we saw the food just sitting on the counter next to the waitress. It took about 25 minutes for them to bring out the bread and butter and a salad that we had ordered which was basically two hearts of romaine with sliced tomatoes and mozzarella on top. Nothing special... we had also ordered the lamb chops and while they do come with four, they are extremely small. After everything is all said and done it was definitely not worth the money that we spent. Which was roughly $50 for three plates. Don't recommend, save your money.
author: Isabel T.

description:
I added a star because when they get an order right, it's pretty tasty pizza. The issue is that they rarely get the order right. I know that I should know better - like Charley Brown kicking the football - but when they get it right... it's tasty pizza. 

multiple times of ordering on-line and calling 1+ hr later to find out they don't have the order. 33% of the time when I put "Thin Crust!!!" everywhere on the order, it comes with major-thick-crust.

Still, even then I'll still do it because when they get it right....

Then this (photo-posted of cheesy-mess squashed into one side of a pizza box).  I emailed them about it with a picture and got no response.  It is with regret that I must call time-of-death on our relationship...
author: T M.

description: A "go to" pizza in our neighborhood!  Service is always friendly and they are supportive of our school.
author: A E.

description: I've heard those jokes about the impossibility to make pizza bad, but I'd never thought that it's not a joke. I feel sorry for people who work there, because this place is definitely not worth it. Went there with my bf, ordered pizza and salad. The crust wasn't crunchy at all, plus its flavor was as if the dough was made for sweet pastry, but not for pizza for sure. It was stuffed with some meat, sausage and cheese, but I didn't feel it - I felt like I'm chewing a mix of some products (not the best ones). Dirty plates from the appetizer remained on the table until the very end and only smile of your young server and his question if we wanted to get our Cokes refilled somewhat saved the situation. I'm sorry, but it was the worst pizza I've tried in my 27 years old life. Thank you for that experience though, I'm wiser now.
author: Oleksandr M.

description: THE WORST PIZZA THAT I'VE EVER HAD. Despite reading the many bad reviews of their pizza, I foolishly ordered for delivery a small #3; The Haystack Pizza: sausage, salami, pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers and onions. I live less than a mile away, it arrived in 45 minutes, but it was beyond soggy; as if they poured water in the box before putting the pizza inside. The sauce was overly sweet and runny, and the RIDICULOUS amount of salt in the pizza made it INEDIBLE. The meat on the pizza tasted cheap and processed, far worse than the cheapest Dominos pizza, and the cheese seemed rubbery, like only the cheapest cheese is. With tip I spent $28.10; unbelievable for a pizza of such poor quality. It tasted like they should've paid me to eat it. If you want to experience the worst pizza of your life; order a pizza for delivery from Haystack Pizza on 24th St.
author: Scott L.

description: This place is pretty good and the food is always delivered hot, fresh and prompt.
author: Darren S.

description:
I really like haystack! Not sure why they only have 3 reviews! We had garlic chicken, onions and mushrooms on our pizza and it was delicious!! 

Service is very nice and parking isn't so bad as you far usually find some parking in the homes around the block. 

Nice bars and lounges nearby should you want to grab an after dinner drink.
author: Carina M.

description:
Had a yummy pizza from here on Sunday. We ordered takeout using their online system and had some issues - better to just call in your order if it's same day. 

The pizza itself was very good and I'll order it again. Only complaint is the crust was a little plain. We built our own pizza - a medium with pepperoni, mushrooms, and jalapeños (they were pickled, not fresh). It wasn't New York Style or Neapolitan style, but was more along the lines of Papa John's or Dominoes (but better). The pizza was just shy of $24. A little steep, considering it was just a pizza - but I know Noe Valley rent so they're probably just trying to pay the bills. The medium easily serves 4 people who eat a normal amount.
author: Kendra N.

description: Where has Janice been?  Best server they have, always super friendly, funny, and welcoming.   Have missed seeing her the last few visits!!  She's the only reason we come.  Great food, service varies depending on the servers!!
author: C B.

description: Last time I ate here was in 1973/74.  It looked different, looked smaller and missing the old family style.  Still a nice place to enjoy traditional italian cooking like pastas, veal, chicken, beef and pizza.  i had the veal scallopini with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Large portion, fresh veggies and tasty mashed potatoes. Well seasoned.  I had to ask for bread after my meal was served. Cold french bread and hard butter came with it, not my cup of tea.
author: Hum V.

description:
This is our go-to pizza delivery place. Always hot, fresh and crisp, and good value for us because one medium pizza is a meal for two and they allow you to build your own.

We've eaten in just once, when we massively over-ordered with a calzone and a small pizza and ended up taking half of it away in boxes. The portions are huge, my calzone seemed to have a whole mozzarella cheese in there from the amount spilling out when I cut it, and the dough was good enough to really enjoy eating even the crust bits.

The atmosphere inside is quirky and we saw some real Italian classics on the menu. Haven't ordered anything except pizza from here yet, but can't wait to try some of the other options.
author: Heather O.

description:
It's nice to have a local pizzeria a block away here in Noe Valley when I have a taste for pizza.

Prices are reasonable and my personal size pizza was good, cheesy and just the perfect size!!

I'm not some pizza expert so all I can say is this place was on the money!!
author: Ron W.

description:
It's strange that the name has the word "pizza" in it, because as near as I can tell, this place does not serve pizza. What they do serve is a type of soggy flatbread covered with cheese and oil, and burnt to a crisp. They then have the audacity to put this thing in a box and ask you to pay for it. 

With dinner successfully ruined, we both decided to have some oatmeal instead. I've posted a picture of our pizza, it was supposed to be the Alberto's Classico.
author: Jesse D.

description:
I was craving some "Italian" food today so I fired up the ol' Eat24. 

I used to order from Haystack back in 2010 and don't remember it being so:
1. Expensive
2. Shitty. 

I ordered the chicken parm with spaghetti and alfredo sauce. It came out to almost $19 with tax before tip. 

The spaghetti was flavorless and congealed into a giant white clump the second it got cold. 
The chicken was dry as hell, the sauce tasted like something out of a jar, and the cheese tasted like cardboard. 

I know I know, I shouldn't have expected much but dang, for $19 I expected a little more. 

1 star because my fat kid Italian food craving has been satisfied for at least another four months. 
2 stars for the sweet lady working the counter.
author: Meh M.

description: My wife and I travel up from San Diego to San Francisco each year around Christmas time and are always on the lookout for good Italian food at reasonable prices.  Too many Italian restaurants in downtown SF are way overpriced for the food.  We were very happy to find Haystack Pizza as an alternative to the high priced food.  We both had the seafood fettuccine which we found to be excellent and a carafe of the house Chianti, also very good.  Service was wonderful and attentive. I'm guessing it was the owners (husband, wife, and son) who took care of us.  The atmosphere was nice, although we both thought the lighting could have been turned down a bit since it was very bright inside.  Dimming the lights some would have helped with the ambiance.  Nonetheless, very much looking forward to returning to the SF area and having dinner at Haystack Pizza!
author: Brian M.

description:
My favorite delivery pizza in San Francisco.  By far.  Thin crust had a good chew to it and it's the only pizza that even remotely reminds me of Brooklyn.  

I've only had the pizza (usually cheese or pepperoni), so can't comment on the sandwiches, pastas, etc.

Delivery comes fast and hot.  Bonus points for having Diet 7Up.
author: Mark T.

description:
Wow! The doorbell rang & it was the pizza delivery guy. And voila! A piping hot pizza (yes hot) arrived from Haystack. The best pizza there is the simple New York. It tastes just like an honest to goodness New York slice, the delicious kind that you fold & eat. The crust is thin and crispy, the sauce sublime. The cheese is perfect, and the herbs add a subtle flavor. But back to the sauce--it's so good. At $13.50 for a medium pie, this beats pretentious Una Pizza Napolitana by a mile. Sure, UPN is good--but it's twenty-five bucks & Zero Zero is less expensive & just as good. Plus Zero won't shame you for asking for chili pepper flakes. (That's right folks--Una Pizza Pretenciosa doesn't ALLOW any condiments except salt. And I've had pizza in Napoli, & it doesn't cost $25.) 

Haystack's NY pizza is the like Napoli's spunky cousin. It looks different, tastes different --but she's just as tasty. Dining in is like stepping back to the Mad Men 60s. Sit with your pals in the back room, and order a  a carafe of Burgundy (yes, Burgundy--I told you, it's old school;) & a plate of antipasti. It comes with the usual suspects: salami, olives, pepperoncini. Then get that New York. You'll be glad you did.
author: Connie C.

description: I remember coming here when I was little. It brings back good memories of when me, my brother and parents would all come here together. Came here today with my dad, it's okay. I've had better pizza, this pizza is very soggy and average. I just like the nostalgia it brings, and it's a low key cute little restaurant. It's just not the best, but it's also not the worst! I'll keep coming back because it brings memories.
author: Juliana F.

description: The service here was good, which is the only reason I gave it two stars instead of one. They were incredibly sweet to us. The location is great on 24th street in the heart of noe valley. The food however was not great. The pizza was soggy. We ordered a thin crust pizza which should be crispy on the bottom but this was not the case. We had to use a knife and fork because the slices just collapsed in a big pile of mess in our hands. Pizza is not meant to be eaten with utensils unless it's deep dish. The sauce was ok, not anything fantastic.
author: Lisa D.

description: I went to Haystack, with a friend, about 3 weeks ago, and ordered the marsala chicken. The chicken was tough and rubbery. I didn't want to deal with it while in the restaurant, and thought I'd be okay, that perhaps it was just overcooked. Shortly after getting home, I was hit with "explosive liquefaction" if you know what I mean. It took the better part of the week before I was back to normal. I wrote a nice e-mail, just suggesting they they look into it. I waited several days, and never heard back. So, I gave them the benefit of the doubt, and resent the e-mail. I've now waited long enough for a response. So, here's my review of my experience.
author: Bob B.

description:
Mercedes is the best. She help me by the phone and gave me the BEST choises ever. 
Raviolis meat sauce & meat balls... Devilish. 
Zorba's Pizza & some yummy deserts... 
Thank you for such a great dinner... At my friends house! 
4 new customers.
author: Beautytraveler G.

description:
Great staff   good wholesome food
I noticed that  the customers tonight    75 percent knew the wait staff and hugged them
Its nice to see that  loyalty amongst customers

Large portions   reasonable price for San Francisco   (full meal for 17 dollars)
author: kavin m.

description:
If I could give this place 0 stars, I most definitely would. Waited over 3 hours for my pizza to be delivered. Driver said nobody picked up the phone, this is a lie we confirmed it 3-4 times every time we checked by calling the restaurant. Waited next to our phone for over 3 hours and didn't receive anything. Just cancelled the pizza. Definitely not paying a single cent it's been 4 hours now at the time of writing this. Off to find pizza elsewhere by foot.

Update: Pizza came in the middle of a very heated conversation between my father and their manager. I calmed him down and went outside to get the pizza. No tip, judge all you want, there is no pity when my 9 year old sister goes to sleep without food because it's 2 hours past her bed time. Paid the exact price and we parted ways. Never ordering from here again. I recommend Marcello's Pizza. Tastier and much better service. I've had pizzas delivered within 35 minutes from them.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
I was actually gonna hold off on writing this, but after reading the most recent posts, this restaurant needs a serious wake up review.

Now, I could go on for sentences talking about how awesome this place USED to be, or how the decor is outdated, blah blah blah. I honestly don't give a rats about minor things like that.

No Haystack, let me tell you about what I expected from you this particular evening, and what I received instead.

I had an awesome walking trip with my family, from Glen Park, all the way up Diamond Heights, back down through Noe Valley, and finally making it to 24th. We were tired, we were hungry. And I personally had a young child who was very whinny after the long walk. 

We went to the first pizza place nearest to us, and had lame service there (check my last review), then left to find a better place. That's when my GF tells me, "Let's go to Haystack!", and a rush of feel good memories hits me. Some of our best dates were at this place. The last time we walked the same route with my family, we ended up here and had a blast. So I was DOWN to eat there.

Enough beating around the bush, let me tell you WHERE YOU JACKED UP(please DON'T excuse my french, because Yelp's guidelines won't allow me to swear). When our FIRST pizza came, it was a size smaller than what we ordered, plus had the wrong toppings. Hey, no big deal, just flag down the waiter, have him take it back, right? Or, it would be right, if the bushy haired server didn't make a face like we're stupid. Didn't even apologize. Dude, in the food industry, I don't care if you didn't even look at the food, you apologize even if its not your fault. Unspoken rule. Period. 

Our waitress comes by, shows us the ticket to prove it wasn't her fault. That's cool, kinda unnecessary, but that's cool. 

SECOND pizza comes. Got the right toppings, YAY. Still the wrong size. Of course we have no choice but to call back the wonderful guy who served it to us, he makes an exasperated sigh (pft, like we WANTED to talk you). So we let him know it a size too small, and that we ordered a medium.

What does he say? "That is a medium"

Wow. You work with pizza. All day. Errday. And we're having size issues?

I had to check him with what his menu says, 10 slices for medium. 8 for a small.

What statement does he counter with? "Look man, I don't slice the pizzas, I just serve them."

That statement speaks for itself of how bad your restaurant sucks. I was so ready to go, but I couldn't, since my fussy child was ready to snap without some pizza. Our waitress comes back, tries to mitigate the situation, halfway through the conversation, server dude comes back with the right one, explains how he got it mixed up. Still no apology, at all, and this time it actually was his fault. Fine, whatever. 

You know, with that attitude, how am I supposed to feel about what happened to the pizza in the back while you were with it...exactly, right? The readers get me.

Then, our waitress decides to throw us the whole "let me get you something comp'd" line. Again wasn't necessary, but she offered free desserts. Cool. 

After we were done with our meal, she was nowhere to be found. What a surprise. Made an empty promise. Like the empty promise your restaurant is. 

Now, the main thing that reeeeeally grinded my gears was the server. Look, man, you were walking around with a nasty scowl on your face. Do you hate your job? If so, why are you still there? I don't know if this is you everyday, but going off of my experience with you, you don't belong in the restaurant biz. You suck, man. Go find a better profession, and stop making people have bad experiences there, you obviously aren't down for the cause. I say this not as a yelper, but as a human being. Go find your place in this world, a pizza shop is most def not it.

As for the restaurant in its entirety, I don't think you should care about whether or not I actually come back. What I really think you should be thinking about is how many bad reviews is it gonna take before you guys realize you suck? 

Oh yeah the pizza was ok.

I check back in a year or two from now, just to see if you guys are still around and convert on the multiple feedback. Hopefully bushy haired angry server won't be there ;)
author: Cesar C.

description:
POISONED, THEN IGNORED!!!!!!
My wife got the cajun linguine with shrimp, which was so-so. 10 minutes later, she was puking her guts out in the clearest case of bad-seafood poisoning imaginable.  This was the only thing she had eaten for 8 hours so it was definitely the Haystack shrimp!
So I called them, not angry (hey, sh*t happens) but to warn them to get rid of that shrimp so other people don't get sick - and it was scary to see how sick my wife was, and in pain for a full day afterward.  I was IGNORED (placed on indefinite hold 3 times) then LIED TO repeatedly (manager was "not there," then "in a meeting" -at 10:30 pm??!!-then she had "just left," and finally "would call me right back from her cell phone."  Never heard from her, ever.
So......if you want to get poisoned, then lied to, then ignored, by all means go to Haystack Pizza on 24th.  VERY bad experience!!
author: Judi Q.

description: This place deserves a 5 star rating. The ordering process was easy. We received our pizza faster than expected. The pizza was amazing and was well worth the price. The pie had a lot of meat, the crust was perfect, and arrived piping hot. I also ordered an apple pie which was really good. I rarely give a 5 star rating but this place really deserves it. Highly recommend this place. Better than the pizza I had at Naples, Italy.
author: Cherelyn G.

description:
Sometimes you're just in the mood for an old-school pizza joint. You want booths that are clean but poorly patched with duct tape. You want waiters who look like they've been here for decades. You want a beer selection not much more complex than "draught or bottle". Appetizers that blow your diet. 

This place does the trick. Everything is very classic old-school pizzaria. Nothing too fancy, nothing too unique. Just the same pizza shop experience that every generation has enjoyed since Italians became Italian Americans and set up this little slice of Norman Rockwell Americana.

Fried calamari were delicious; though next time I'd ask for marinara sauce (which I'm sure they have) instead of tartar sauce and cocktail sauce. The pizza was a homerun. Not gourmet, just awesome. Server just seemed like one of your Dad's friends who's been running the joint for 20 years.

Really chill, good pizzaria.
author: Sean B.

description:
I walked past Haystack last night on yet another unusally gorgeous San Fran evening with my lovely roommates, reminiscing about a date I had gone on a while back with a seemingly nice guy. 

How my heart pitter-pattered for my former lover. How inexperienced I was in the ways of casual dating. And how shattered I was when I found out he was playing the same games with four other girls.

But, live and let die a horrible, horrible death. That's the expression, right?

So while I batted my lashes and tried to sensually eat my pizza and make interesting small talk, I realized just how good the food was. And now, here I am wishing I could wap myself on the head with something hard to wake up past me out of my dreamy stupor to focus on what really matters in life: Food.

Starting off, we got Mozzerella Sticks ($8.50). On a date? Really Crys? Hell yes. My tummy was in the right place obviously. 

We split the Greek Salad ($11.50) as well which was very fresh and honestly probably one of the best Greek's I've had. 

Next we had Alberto's Classico (Medium $18.50)  which was basily, tomatoey goodness, oozing with mozzerella cheese. No sauce, but you can order it if you prefer.

The decor is cute, kind of old school and funky. Not that it matters, good food is good food is good food, but it's Greek food, not Italian. Doesn't matter to me, Dino and Santino's is another favorite of mine in Pac Heights and they are of Greek descent as well. A bit pricey for pizza and salad, but I'm a cheap date and it was Noe Valley.   Looking back, all things happen for a reason. And we had a lot of lovely times together, no matter how big of a d-bag he turned out to be.
author: Crystal C.

description: I love their chicken wings! The pizza was also delicious. Thin crust and great flavor. Ill order from them again. Great and friendly service.
author: Alex P.

description:
This place is quiet nice for dinner. I tried their buffalo chicken and cheese pizza. Chicken strips are crispy and fresh but salty but the pizzas are really good.
One thing I didn't like about this place is the service, I guess there are very few people taking orders and we had to wait quite sometime for our chance. Over all food is good but the service is very pathetic.

This is my first review in yelp, hope it helps.
author: Vijay Kumar M.

description:
I ordered delivery on 6/3/16 at 8:55pm from Haystack. Lasagna, Chicken Jerusalem and Ravioli for me and my girlfriends. 
I had to give my address multiple times over the phone because the person on the other line couldn't understand me. I spelled it out one letter at a time A like apple-Z like zebra -T like tiger....,Aztec,  not  a hard word to understand. Perhaps their phones weren't working right? Who knows. 
My house is 8 minutes away from their restaurant, according to Google maps, which is why it surprised and annoyed me that after an hour and a half of waiting our food still had not arrived. 
I called Haystack to see what had happened and their reply was "Oh, the driver couldn't find your house so he came back."

Really? The driver couldn't find my house so instead of calling me so I could give him the directions he returned back to the restaurant without giving any notice. I wonder would they have ever called me or just charged my card $60 and left me in the dust? 

I was really disappointed in the fact that when I offered directions to my house the man on the phone replied " We close in 5 minutes". I took that as him implying the driver would not be returning to complete the delivery.  

I asked the man on the phone to keep our food for us and that we would be there shortly to pick it up. It only took 6 minutes to get to Haystack and when I arrived the food wasn't ready. 

After waiting another 10 minutes the food came out without an apology, explanation or offer to remedy the mistakes they had made. They just sent me on my way. 

This experience made the food taste horrible and I will not be returning.
author: Haleigh A.

description: I have no complaints about this place - the pizza was delicious and the staff was super courteous. Possibly due to the low(er) reviews on Yelp, I didn't have to wait to be seated during dinnertime, and I'm starting to really value that around here. I'll be back!
author: Sara H.

description: Cheap, kid friendly Italian restaurant. Most things are covered in butter, the portions are big and the price is fair given the neighborhood. We only come here when we are with folks with kids. Pizza is fair- good but nothing special. The service can be pretty slow though.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Saturday night dinner with my mom, ordered the haystack special and it was delicious. Great flavor, crust, and fresh toppings.
author: Ingrid J.

description:
I really enjoyed my meal from Haystacks. The artichoke & crab Meze was delicious as well and the antipasta salad and the Zorba pizza.

What I didn't enjoy was the RUDE service we received. Which is why the low star score. We were seated in the very back area and it took forever for someone to take our drink order or offer water. We were the only ones seated back there. It took another 10 min or so after that for the server to come back with our drinks. After we ordered, our food came out fairly fast. What I didn't appreciate was when we ordered desert. The server/busboy (short guy with nappy long hair who ties it back in a man bun) took our desert order got our order wrong. We ordered pecan pie and pumpkin cheesecake. Not that hard to remember. Instead he brought out 2 different pies. When we told him that these were the wrong pies, he gets mad and storms off saying loud enough so that we can hear "Damn, I'm just trying to go home already!" and continues bitching and complaining as he walks into the kitchen. Mind you, the kitchen isn't that far from where we are sitting so we heard everything. The lady who was our original server comes back to apologize but the damage was already done. Now I understand why this place has such a low rating. I would never want someone who has an attitude and is rude to customers working for me.
author: Robyn S.

description:
I being a customers for about 8 or 9 years and I could say that the service is better with more staff.
Pizza is great not to thin or thick.
We always ask for thick crust and extra sauce and fresh basil,definetly our favorite.
My kids love the hawaian pizza and I really enjoyed their lasagna, is awesome!
Defitnetly our favorite pizza place in the city!
author: damariz m.

description: My partner and I love haystack! It's a family-friendly place with great customer service. We had it delivered recently and it came super fast. The crust is delicious and we get the Luigi almost every time; it's so good!
author: Brittany V.

description: The pizza is the best! The Alexander is what I go for with extra chz. The service is poor but the pizza makes up for it. The girl busser was good to us, but the lady server who took our order had a horrible attitude . She thought we were talking about her when she came to take our order and called my friend out on it! You can tell she hates her job, just nasty. But when the pizza came she disappeared and the meal was the best ! I've read a few reviews and a lot say the service isn't good. Get it owners???
author: Ladyreyes R.

description: Walked by as me and my boyfriend were looking for a place to eat dinner, and decided to try it. The Pizza was so delicious. You definitely get double for what you pay.
author: Kristy A.

description: The woman who takes the orders put me on hold twice tonight and couldn't get my phone number right after I gave it to her 4 times.  4.  That has to be a new record for a native english speaker in the service industry.  When I got upset, she said I anger easily.  Thanks for the feedback.
author: Isaac C.

description:
They're great if you eat in or do a pickup, but their deliveries take way too long (over an hour and a half) and they don't really care (when I called I was lied to twice about status of my order).

Don't order online, via an app, or by phone, it won't matter. Just get in the car and drive over and get it yourself. At least that way you can have a beer while you wait.

Also theres a pretty good chance they'll get the order wrong.

Just do not order delivery.
author: mike m.

description: If I could leave zero stars I would. Extremely rude service. Delivery that took hours and cold (incorrect) pizza. The food here can sometimes be pretty good but the service is so bad it doesn't make it worth it. Dining in is a bit better than delivery, but the staff is still rude either way.
author: Christie K.

description:
The pizza never arrived.  I called 4 times (which I know is a lot-I'm hungry)
The pizza is mediocre, I have had it before.  I reluctantly ordered it because another pizza join in Noe is a joke.  

DONT ORDER FROM HERE!!!!!
author: maker of p.

description: Got the New Yorker and it was a brilliant pizza! The delicate proportion of oregano, garlic and cheese was wonderful. Definitely one of the best thin crust pizzas I've ever had.
author: Rajan D.

description: Pizza was great and salad dressing was so so good. They delivered at midnight which was a tad bit later than what was told to me, so that is my only -1 star.
author: Fallon H.

description: Terrible service....rude waiter and waited 40min for pizza with only 3 other tables on restaurant and no noticeable to go orders...must have a really really good lease, to survive on 24th St in noe
author: Eric T.

description: I wish I could give them a 6 star rating. The service was above and beyond from the moment I walked in with my wife and kids. Our host was great a young man D. He did something most places dont when I asked for waters he brought my son and daughter child cups plus crayons and paper. Our waiter was a very nice man and made nice conversation with us we felt at home in this place. A man whom I believe to be the owner or manager with a mustach was excellent with his customer service and took pride in the resturant as we waited for our food the pizza #10 which was breath taking. He went out side to sweep the street and the resturant you don't see owners or managers do that much. He was a class act and this will now be our familys pizza/pasta resturant for years to come. It was a delight to dine here
author: Rudy M.

description:
I was house and dog sitting for a friend of mine in the neighborhood, and as luck would have it, their dog developed what we scientists professionally refer to as "the shits" and I had to go to the Death Star (I believe it's called "Whole Foods" if you translate it to hipster) to pick up some chicken and broth to make dinner for the dog. Since Haystack was nearby, I decided to pick up dinner on the way back.

I saw a random tip on the Yelp that said to order the wings here. Despite spending an entire week in San Francisco, I was somehow still a mainstream consumer whore. Oh wait no, I was just hungry and wanted wings and pizza. BEST DECISION EVER.

Them chicken wings were meaty and tender, probably right up there with the best I have ever had. That was after I had walk for about 15 minutes at night and then let the wings sit for another 30 minutes at room temperature while I cooked dinner for the dog first. The thick creamy ranch they provide was perfect for these wings. I ordered a personal pizza as well and they loaded it up with the toppings. The bacon they used was the thick-cut pieces instead of wimpy bacon bits that you would find elsewhere.

GIVING THIS PLACE 1-STAR IS LIKE GIVING FREEDOM 1-STAR. WHY DO YOU PEOPLE HATE FREEDOM?
author: Ian L.

description:
The slowest service in the world. I've been here over an hour and even the many waiters
--only one overworked waitress--don't seem to make the food come. Once it came it was ok.
author: Peter G.

description:
Not bad but, unremarkable

I ordered the namesake, the "Haystack" pizza. The toppings were good but the crust was on the meh side. Slightly burned on the edges and soggy in the middle. Then, they committed the cardinal pizza sin, it was served on an aluminum platter on top of one of those wire stands. So, your first piece is piping hot, the second tepid, and everything else, just cold and soggy.

The waitress was friendly and attentive (giving the place 3 stars instead of two).

If these guys focus on the food more, there's some real potential here.
author: Paul D.

description:
WHY DOES NO ONE ORDER THE CHICKEN WINGS HERE. MY GOODNESS. 

I love chicken wings that are crispy, a little seasoned and not too greasy (in which my preference is that I definitely don't like saucy wings). With that being said, I honestly think Haystack has one of the most scrumptious wings I've ever had. It's completely worth throwing into an order with your pizza (maybe not in large groups though, unless you're willing to get more than one order - maybe 1 order per 3 people would be good). 

And another thing: No one here on yelp mentions the ranch that they order for the restaurant. I'm not even going to describe how perfectly viscous the ranch is - all I'm saying is that you have to trust me that this ranch is absolutely perfect and that unfortunately the ranch is not sold in stores :(


No comments on the pizza though, I'll leave those ratings to other yelpers. But yes, I enjoyed my pizza here very much (The Alexander: sausage, salami, pepperoni, and mushroom, delicious). 

This place is nice for dates and small families; I haven't had a really good experience with large groups due to how long it takes for the food to come out, so I recommend just a small amount of people for the best experience.
author: Tiffany A.

description:
We way, way, way over- ordered.....
The pizza was good but the word "soft" comes to mind.  It was chewy and "soft".  The sausage and mushroom combination was perfect--we could actually taste the mushrooms.  The sausage was tasty too.
I ordered the chicken parmigiana with a side of linguine and vegetables.  My partner ordered the veal parmigiana with the same sides.
I have never seen such a large amount of food served  in SF--ever.  The portions were huge.
We wound up taking half the pizza home as well as  half of our entrees. 
This place is definitely a "time bubble" kind of place.  It is old school Italian that has never changed in taste, presentation or recipes.  It's been open since 1972.  Every song that we heard playing in the restaurant was from that time frame too.  From Seals and Croft''s "Diamond Girl" to Elton John's "Daniel".  Time warp?  Time bubble?
The food, albeit from yesteryear,  was pretty good.
author: Thomas D.

description: Old school decent pizza (good crust) in the land of the precious. Love it!
author: M M.

description: Haystack has a lot of overpriced unpleasant Italian style food of all sorts.  Veal Parmesan filed with lots of gristle and too much soggy stale breading was particularly foul.  So-called thin crust cheese pizza missed the mark-Too much cheese and sauce with a mealy crust.  Years ago when my kids were young and liked going there it might have been better. Noe Valley needs a good casual Italian place and Haystack is not the one.  I must say the wait staff is nice.
author: Richard D.

description: If you are looking for pizza in Noe, go elsewhere. All things being equal I prefer to support small local businesses, but this place is really subpar. The pizza is pretty gross. Service is detached and diffident. I have no idea how this place stays open.
author: C X.

description: In love! This is my new favorite place. The service sucks but the amazing food makes up for it! I ordered the vegetarian pizza and let me tell you it was the best I've ever had!! The bottom crust was crispy, the sauce was delish and the vegetables were plenty. 1/2 of the pizza had pepperoni and it was good too. Oh, the iced tea is also on point. I can't wait to bring some friends. It's a hidden gem. I saw some of the other pasta dishes coming out of the kitchen and they looked good too. It's a very family kinda of place and the 80's music just added to the atmosphere. David Bowie + pizza = win!
author: Tony B.

description: Marcella was awesome. She made the best Mediterranean salad 'from the heart' I have ever had. Just awesome.
author: Ron M.

description: I love Haystack. They deliver late in Noe Valley which no one else does and the pizza is delicious. It's old-school-thicker crust, a lot of cheese-but I love it and the sausage and pepperoni are tasty too.
author: Lydia B.

description: The pizza was very fresh and tasted great. Salad dressings tasted homemade. Service was also great. Only complaint is the pizza could have used a drip pan underneath it to help remove the grease. Didn't slow me down eating it though
author: Chad W.

description:
Haystack was our neighborhood go-to pizza place growing up.  I mean, before I learned how to drive and opted for Milano's or Pasquale's.  But whenever I'm visiting the folks, they will still order from here since it's just a few blocks away.  I always remembered it as just being okay.  Our default toppings are always pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom.  Haystack's sausage is unique, but everything else was just average.  

Flash forward to present day.  This month we've ordered from them twice and I gotta say, something's changed.  And for the better!  I'm not sure if it's the sauce or the dough.  Maybe it's the dough.  It definitely seems different.  Fluffier.  Well, whatever it is, both times we got takeout and both times I ate 3 or 4 slices when I usually limit myself to 2 max.  And it's not that I wasn't thouroughly full after 2 slices.  It just tasted really good and my mouth kept begging me to keep the good times rolling.  And it wasn't just me that noticed a difference.  We all did.  I think the consensus is that the dough is different.  Well, whatever it is, kudos Haystack for improving your pizza.  Coming from a person that LOVES pizza and spends a lot of time in Noe Valley, that's a job well done!
author: Joe M.

description: I'll start by saying, Service is incredibly slow!!! BUT the food is great. I always get chicken cordon blue, it's amazing. Comes with veggies & choice of another side I always get mashed potatoes & my bf always gets spaghetti!! Both soooo good!!  I've had their pizza many times it's also delish!!! Their crust is pretty thick tho so I like to specify thin crust!!  I would give 5 stars but service is really really slow.  Still I love this spot!!
author: Natasha P.

description: The worst Italian in Noe Valley. Charming atmosphere, but the food is basic. The pizza is mediocre. The staff are on the strange side. We've eaten there several times and finally just stopped after giving it numerous chances. For pizza go to Twin Peaks. There are better Italian a few blocks to the West on 24th.
author: David H.

description: Bad reviews regarding this establishment is BOGUS!!!!! Great food, atmosphere, servers, and drinks!!! Fourth time here, first time leaving a review. I came with wife and young daughter, ordered mozzarella appetizer, calamari , medium pizza, and a salad! Dishes were out quick and servers all had great attitudes! Did I mention it was full of customers!! Thanks a lot guys! Definitely will be back!!!!
author: Cee S.

description: I enjoy their pizza always on point, they have all kinds of combinations or make your own and they also deliver takes a little longer but always worth the wait. great service
author: Leslie C.

description: We used to regularly order from here, but haystack just lost our business. We ordered a haystack pizza and normally it comes with mushrooms. When they delivered it was missing the mushrooms, my favorite part. I called them to tell them and they basically said they would send the driver back to give me $2 for the mushrooms. Seriously? If you get the order wrong you either make it right by making another one or at least discount me 15%-20% for the inconvenience. And of course Im not gonna make the poor driver come all the way back just to give me $2, especially when I paid by credit card. Why would they even suggest that? Guess they don't know how to keep customers. Pizza is soggy too.
author: Katrina L.

description: The food is good, but the service is horrendous! They really need to work on being more attentive and also on service overall. Especially when they themselves are the ones who are in the wrong, I guess you can tell I had a bad experience here. It's sad really because I tolerated the sevice up until now because the wings and calamari were really good, but no longer.
author: H P.

description:
Before Saturday Night, it had been awhile since I have been to Haystack's pizza. After Saturday Night, I won't wait that long again. It was very good, but here are my reasons for loving it:

1.) We needed a place at the last minute for 15 and they fit us right in. We had one long table that was fit for the Queen's Crew (Happy Birthday Monica!!!). It was very reasonable price wise too~

2.) The Owner, when carding me - actually thought I was underage! LOL, won  me over - right there. Okay, I guess I shouldn't have included that in my review, but it was awesome.

3.) Most importantly - the food, the salads were huge and great. The Greek Salad had all the fixin's of a great greek salad. The house salad, although intended to be a personal side salad was very large as well.

The pizzas were delish! (See MY posted pics) We ordered:
1.) Luigi the Italian, which was Pesto, Fresh Garlic and Tomato - really good and one of my favorites. 
2.) Cleopatra, grilled eggplant, sun dried tomato, fresh garlic, feta and red sauce.
3.) The Haystack, Sausage, Salami, pepperoni, mushroom, bell pepper and onion. Very Good.
4.) Jolly Green Giant, Broccoli, Zuchinni, Fresh Garlic, Onions, Mushrooms and Fresh Tomato. 

I only tried No. 1 and 3 of the pizza list above, but they all looked wonderful and everyone enjoyed their meals.

I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I enjoy Haystack - whether dining in or getting it to go.  I usually order from there at least 2x monthly, either for pizza or pasta (most recent order was last week for 1/2 ravioli, 1/2 spaghetti).  That order was just as good as when I've gotten the same thing at Joe's of Westlake (which is great).  

The only thing that keeps me from coming more often is their prices which are $2 - $3 higher than what I'd expect.  

The staff is quite friendly and I find it most enjoyable sitting at the bar when eating in...
author: Anjanette B.

description: This has been my my go to pizza delivery place for a while but the last couple of orders have been below par. Fast, friendly service but the quality is now questionable. I'll probably give them one more try before moving on.
author: David D.

description: Absolutely horrible. Pizza and wings were the same quality as generic frozen foods. Pizza dough is not chewy and is too thick, sauce has unbalanced acidity, too much sugar, and is watery. Wings were tender but flavorless. Must be CAFO chicken. Uninspired. One of those pizza places that is driven by margin instead of passion. I hope they take this review as an opportunity to make some real change.
author: Christopher w.

description: I love Haystack!! Their pizza is delicious! Their pastas are very good and tasty! Love their garlic bread! Would recommend to a friend!!
author: Janet P.

description: The pizza and other food is solid but wow is it expensive.   We ordered a small and medium with two toppings and it was over $40.  Wow wow wow.  Yes I know noe is expensive these days, but seriously how can they survive with their prices being more expensive than a meal at the "fancy" pizza places on Valencia.   I used to love you guys Haystack, but way way too expensive to come back now.   You were a great go to for a quick well priced family meal but those days are apparently long gone :(
author: Jaime A.

description:
Good, solid pizza. it was doughy, and cheesy, and classic. Good old-school atmosphere inside the restaurant, too. I loved the old western theme. Kinda cheesy and silly, just like a pizza parlor should be! 

I sat inside and ordered a take out order. The girl who helped me was cool and chatted with me for while the pizza was cooking. 

My only qualm would be the prices. I think they are a tad bit high for the quality and ambience. I would lower all the prices like $3-4. That would be more fair and reasonable. 

I was willing to pay those prices though because I would like to see this place stay in business, so there it is.
author: Alanna R.

description:
They Lost Their Spark

I Came here Yesterday With My Sister For Dinner. The Waiter Who Greeted Us And Took Our Seats Seemed Busy And Anxious. A Bit Later, An Other Waiter Gave Us Menus And Water. Looking At Te Menu, Everything Is Way High Priced! My Sister And I  Both Got Personal Pizzas. When The Pizza Came, It Was Flavorless. I Had To Add a Bunch Of Cheese, And Hot Pepper Flakes For The Pizza To Taste Good. All in All, I Wouldn't Come Here Again. The Food Is High Priced, And Not That Good.
author: Susana R.

description: Best pizza on the whole of 24th street! Talk about bang for your buck and fast delivery.
author: Jenna O.

description: This place is pretty solid. The veggie pizza was a little soggy in the middle, and it tore apart when I picked my first piece (and every piece thereafter). Other than that the pizza tasted pretty good and the customer service was good while we waited. They let us order a pizza for pick up 15 minutes before they closed. They're one of the only restaurants in Noe Valley open past 10:00, so it's great for a nighttime pizza emergency.
author: Jenny G.

description: This pizza is terrible. Very nice people and fast delivery, but the quality of taste is awful. I don't recommend wasting your money on this. It will leave you hungry and unsatisfied.
author: Steve H.

description:
I like this little family style place. I was here on Monday, for a writer's group meeting. The decor and atmosphere is relaxing, yes, a bit old fashioned but very comfortable and low-key. Service was good. I like the soup and pasta but I thought it a little over priced for the side dish portions. 

I was told by several to order the pizza. Next time I visit, I will. I was disappointed that they do not serve pizza by the slice. And, I was disappointed that they do not serve a few Greek food dishes, like Moussaka. 

The reason why I say this is because as I understand it, the restaurant is owned by a Greek family who came to SF from Greece in the early 1970's and settled in Noe Valley. The decor has some Greek themes and so I was anticipating at least one or two items on the menu to be inspired by Greek food. But no, only Italian style dishes. 

I was also disappointed by the house red wine. It tasted mellow, but the next morning I had such a headache, and only after one glass. That's not a good sign. I also thought it sad that Haystack charges for bread and butter. Garlic bread, I can understand, but basic bread and butter? If that's the case then why not charge for serving plain tap water? Other than, that, I really like Haystack and yes, I will return. 

Hopefully some day soon they will serve something Greek-inspired, like Moussaka. Perhaps you can tell, that's one of my favorites.
author: Jonathan F.

description: I can say their Pizza making is completely inconsistent. I have went 4 times and my pizza has been different every time. I can tell that it's the only pizza  place around so I still continue to go. The servers are horrible, but the bartender is the reason why I keep coming back! She is awesome! So if you want to dine in. Sit with Kim!
author: Mikayla S.

description:
Holy cow--what a great pizza!

My wife ordered two of these for dinner tonight from her work and then brought them home.  We had a cheese pizza and a veggie pizza and just kept devouring slices until there was almost none left.  I think there's not even enough for lunch tomorrow.  This is really the best-tasting pizza I've had in a long time--I've had a fair amount of pizza recently, and this one comes out pretty near the top.  Delivery service was pretty friendly too.

I really want to try sitting down at this joint and trying out some of the other food that they have here.
author: Matthew D.

description: They shorted us a meal on our delivery order. Then refused to make good on the mistake. Avoid Haystack at all costs.
author: MArk H.

description: Good.  Made me happy, but nothing special.  I would actually give the pizza a 2.5.  The staff gets a 5!  Wonderful, attentive, fun staff...rather average, generic pizza.  There aren't many pizza options in Noe Valley.  Patxis is the way to go.
author: Evan M.

description:
***UPDATE*****

*wakes up sober*  It wasn't that great!

*****************************************

Mozart's birthday today.

I'm giving Haystack 4 stars on Principal.  I'd even give this 5 stars amid the true San Franciscan style pizza places.

The service was perfect here tonight.  I don't even know who served me!   I don't even recall who the waitress was who served me.  Whoever she (or he or it was), I left he, she or it a 25% tip because it was a rarity: perfect service.  I define this as feeling as if the food magically appears before me.  Dam, was our server an Artesian? or an alien?  Maybe the toothfairy or a Greek Leprecaun.

It was refreshing not to hear a, "is everything ok?"   Of course everything ISN'T ok.  We're in San Francisco: the city of no parking, futia colored walls because Richard Simmons says white and gray walls lack panache, pilates, the final dump of forgotten trends from around the globe.

Well I happen to love bright grey walls dammit!

*sips another shot glass of port*

Where was I?  Yeah, 4 stars, I enjoyed this place.

Even Budweiser on tap.  I nearly cried from the Nostalgia.
author: Tony U.

description: I ordered linguini and clams with garlic sauce. They were very generous with the clams, and it was good. I'll be ordering from here again.
author: B A.

description: They lose 1 more star b/c the website now is just an error message that indicates you should call the store :(
author: Kelvin B.

description: We ordered thru Eat24. Got delivery sooner than promised--about 45 minute wait. Antipasto was great--much better than last time when the toppings were skimpy.  Meatball sandwiches were meh. Not enough sauce or cheese, flavorless meatballs; $12 each including side of fries or spaghetti.  Total cost of $50 was a lot for just one quality item.
author: Mary L.

description:
I've been to Haystack's a few times and have always been satisfied. Haystack's is the definition of comfort food for me. It's no frills pizza and offers a casual, welcoming environment in the heart of Noe Valley.

From traditional cheese and pepperoni to vegetarian to 'the-make-your-own' pizzas, you really can't go wrong. There are tons of options all at great prices. It's definitely a solid, local spot for families and for groups. Get the pepperoni pizza rolls, it's a tasty starter!

The service is kind, quick and knowledgeable! Our server gave us recommendations on pizzas and starters, made sure we had drinks refilled and always came by to check up on us.

If you are in Noe Valley and are craving pizza, Haystack's is a great choice!
author: Stephanie C.

description: We went to Haystack last night, because we were too late to make it down to Pauline's. The half/half vege/cleopatra had too much tasteless cheese and too much garlic. There was lipstick on my beer glass, which I only noticed half way through. The server didn't seem very interested in anything. Next time, just go to Pauline's...
author: Stuart J.

description:
We are dinner here last night and were not all that impressed with the food. We had artichoke crab dip that was ok and Old McDonald pizza that was just ok. It had onions and garlic in it that was barely cooked. Garlic is yummy, but not half raw garlic. 

What stuck out and impressed us with our visit here was the waitress, Jill. I would give the place a 5 if we were rating her. She was a machine. She seemed to be running the front of the house on her own, even though there were 2 other wait staff "working".  

We hate that the food was not great, but happy to meet Jill.
author: Shawn W.

description:
Another Pizza joint that has stood the test of time (decades), and test of millions (maybe billions)  taste buds. While never having ventured outside the pizza fare, I am fan. The down-to-earth.... pizza comfort food and neighborhoody (is that a word?), 

http://www.haystackpizza.com/

Again, I LOL at some reviews (not all in reference to Haystack !), some classics include dining on Thanksgiving ("had to find a place" .....hmmmm must be, that family didn't invite the reviewer), Christmas (anyone seen "A Christmas Story ?) New Years Eve (ewe .... chasing pizza on the last day of the year) only to discover the waiter/waitress/cashier/busboy was not in the best mood.... dahhhh.

Favorite pies include "The Haystack" and  "Zorba the Greek" (kinda great since the original founder is of Greek heritage).
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Only 3 stars!? I'm SHOCKED!

Haystack Pizza rocks! While I have only ordered from here twice, I have NEVER been disappointed! 

The food is straight-up italian deliciousness--huge portions, lip-smacking delectable food and enough cheese on your chicken parm to sink a ship ::drool::

Delivery is super fast, and the guys are incredibly nice and the food is scrumptious. They told me that the wait time for delivery was approx 45mins and I think it got to me in 20... nice and piping hot and ready for me to devour (which I did!)

MM-mm eat here if you want some down home italian cooking!
author: Alyssa S.

description: Eggplant parm is always delicious. I have had it delivered at least 4 times. Don't get the veg on the side though, garlic potatoes are much better!
author: Holly M.

description: I love thin crust pizza and they make theirs just right. Their eggplant parm is delish! Zack is by far the best server there!
author: Fallon P.

description:
After Noe Valley Restaurant closed a couple years ago, this is the only remaining "old-school" Italian restaurant/pizza joint in the hood.

Despite the negative reviews from the recent transplants who think they've patented cool, Haystack has good food at reasonable prices.  These other, unhelpful Yelpers, seem to forget that people have different tastes, and guess what, you can order Haystack's pizza with thin crust or their traditional, thicker crust.  Yelp isn't a forum for you to announce your personal taste, it's a place to give honest reviews about whether a business is reputable, or not.

Yes, La Ciccia is a better Italian restaurant, and for those of us who don't like Patxi's "gourmet" pizza, this is the go-to place when you just want a pepperoni pizza and spaghetti with meatballs without busting out a Grant.
author: Xu D.

description: After a looooong day, my girlfriend and I decided to eat pizza at Haystack, the last time we came we had poor service but we decided to give it another go. We walked in , only like 2 tables were occupied, and waited about 5 minutes until someone finally noticed us. She pointed us to sit in a table right by the entrance which we weren't to happy about. Then we waited a while until she finally came to get our orders. She just came up and looked at us, and my girlfriend said," Uhhh to drink I'd like... And to eat we'll have..." And she left. We waited about another 15 minutes watching her just talk at the bar and no one ever brought our drinks out. We had enough and left, horrible service. Never going back
author: Nigel F.

description:
Use to love this place for delivery. And I've had delivery no less than 15 times. Thin crust WAS great. However, the last 2 orders have been BAD. I almost think there must have been turnover in the kitchen. The pizza was under cooked and was just an overall sloppy mess. It was nothing like the pizza they would normally produce.

I'll give it a couple of weeks and try again but if that pizza turns out bad, I'm done.
author: Kendall T.

description:
P-i-z-z-a!  My daughter, Kris and her fiance, Aaron took me here for my birthday.  Impeccably delicious!  I brought my girlfriend, Dani from Brazil here.  

Dani ate and never said a word because she couldn't stop eating.  Dani loves Haystacks!  The reason is clear why I brought my foreign friend to Haystacks with no embarrassment or worries.
author: Shirley M. J.

description: Classic neighborhood pizza restaurant and bar. I have been a regular for years and always find the staff very friendly and attentive.
author: Todd D.

description:
The pizza is good...
The problem there was the "CRAZY" bolivian guy... He just a driver there but he was driving everybody crazy, like the  owner, manager, workmates, clients,etc...  
I heard he's not working there anymore... Now i believe haystack bussiness will go up again....
Fck this krazy bolivian guy.... Ah ah ah ah
author: marcio d.

description: I LOVE their pizza! They do not specialize in thin crust or deep dish, but just the classic traditional American style pizza, and they do it perfectly! Simple flavors with a soft yummy crust. If you want just a classic American style pizza, this is the place to go. If you're in the mood for thin crust Neapolitan pizza like from Delfina, Farina or Mozzeria, this place is not for you.
author: Luna R.

description: I love haystack and it's neighborhood vibe. The sourdough crust is on point!
author: Henry T.

description: Been ordering from here for the past 10 years. The food is decent but not amazing.  Every time you call, you will speak with the rudest person.  You will want to hang up and order from somewhere else, but maybe realize it's late so you go through with your order even though you've regretted giving money to a business that has treated you so badly. I'll give two stars because the food passes for delivery, but honestly wish I would never have to talk to one of their employees ever again.
author: J P.

description: Not sure how they are still in business in Noe valley! This area needs an upgrade. We ordered delivery and it arrived undercooked and pretty gross. Won't order from here again
author: Roshni P.

description:
This is honestly one of the only older businesses in Noe Valley.  Many of the other places have been there for less than 15-20 years, which to me is very "new."

I grew up eating here as a kid, and it's still damn good.

I get thick crust pizza and the salads are big and fresh.

It's very no frills and it has a great old Western decor scheme going that is lovely.  I think it's a real relief to come here.  There aren't a lot of places on 24th that are very worthwhile or quick.
author: Julia D.

description:
Pizza arrived within 45 minutes on a Friday, so that wasn't bad. When I took a bite of it, though, it was burnt quite badly and tasted terrible. For some reason, I also ordered fried zucchini and it arrived swimming in grease and a little overcooked as well.

A quick call back got apologies and the offer to refund or send out another. I was in a hurry so I took the refund. The lady was nice, so I'll give them another shot. I'll revise my review at a later date...

I posted a pic of the burnt pizza.
author: Adam L.

description:
One star for the very good service.Zero stars for the pizza.
Being the pizza fanatic I am,I'm always on the lookout for new good pizza places.
A friend of mine recommended this place and said it was very good.
I always try the pepperoni or pepperoni and mushroom first to try a new pizza place,so I can taste other important things on the pizza too,like the cheese and sauce.Not the typical sauce here.Hardly any cheese on the pizza either.Just wasn't feeling it here.Wont go back.
author: Mike M.

description:
Haven't tried the pizza yet, which seems to be popular.

I'm new to the area and chose this place over an Italian chain restaurant just a block away thinking it looks like a local family owned kind of place with fresh made authentic pasta. Not that many customers, pasta was just ok, not worth the price or wait. I can make similar 'trader joes' pasta at home for 1/4th the price. 
This place reminded me of the show where chef Gordon Ramsey rescues restaurants with some potential. 
Service and decor are good. Friendly staff but need a little more enthusiasm in the kitchen maybe?
author: A K.

description:
So there I was, attending our quarterly pub crawl.  This time, Noe Valley.  As the light buzz started to set in, I realize that I've not eaten.  Then, like a beacon on a stormy shore, there was Haystack Pizza.

I continued to drink, of course, but knew I needed to wrap it up in time to place an order and abscond with it to scarf at home, or in the car ride on the way. 

That said, the staff was great, and the pizza was delicious.  It's tough to get crunch and chewy right with pizza, but it was done.  The pepperoni was delicious and perfectly crisp around the edges...just like I like it.

Even the next day, the slice was just as delicious.  The perfect reminder of the great night I had prior!
author: Andy S.

description: I absolutely love this pizza place... Every time I come to city when I'm craving pizza this is the place to go... I've been coming here for 20+ years since I was little with my parents... The dough is so good.. I also like the calzone and the linguini and clams with white sauce... I definitely recommend this spot...
author: Prisma P.

description: If you want a little 1970's flashback, come to the Haystack. Pizza grease and '70's rock to bring you back to a time when life was simple and dinner out was fun.
author: Melissa H.

description: The pizza took over 80 minutes to arrive and tasted like cardboard. We will NOT be ordering from them again!
author: Alison T.

description:
what i ordered... "the haystack" pizza, hot artichoke with crab meze

pizza was normal in size but was so heavy. pie could have been great if it wasn't for the blandest marinara sauce i have ever tasted. other fillings were abundant and good especially with the veggies.

hot artichoke with crab meze was mediocre though generous in size. tasted so oily, it felt like eating mayo. and the italian bread was lightly toasted and soaked with butter.

ambiance... great (place was antique and clean... and the cuckoo clock was a cherry on top)
service... ok (drop and go with a wicked smile)
cost...$$ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description: I enjoyed their pizza! Staff was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the vegetarian pizza and it was bursting with flavor.
author: Megan B.

description:
I was here once a couple years ago and it was okay enough to return to. After this last time, I won't be back again. The server was a weirdo and he was giving us a serious case of heeby jeebies. 

He applied a hard sell on beverages and we just asked for water and he sarcastically said "ok a shot of ouzo and a shot of jack daniels" he said as if it were a joke but with undertones of "sure thing, cheapskates"

He barely spoke to us the entire meal after that. The only sound we got out of him was the sound of our salad plates being dropped onto the table with a bang as if he was frustrated with us for reasons unknown. 

We were seated at a pretty large table for 3, and when the pizza came he set it down directly on my wife's placemat although we made space in the center of the table for it. Again, he said nothing and left. A good server usually starts you off with your first slice. The place was next to empty so it's not as if he had somewhere else to be. 

We sat there for 10-15 min after finishing eating before I had to ask for the check and he says "yeah yeah" under his breath as he walks away, such a weirdo. When it came time for him to earn his tip he got jokey again. I pull out my credit card and he said "no she is the woman she has to pay!" What? I understand he was trying to be funny, but that joke just didn't make sense and instead came off weird and sexist. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Oh, I forgot to write about the food. Our salad was so-so, the lettuce seemed to be a mix of romaine and iceberg with emphasis on iceberg. The dressing was crap. The pizza was pretty bad. The sauce was watery and lightly applied. The cheese seemed to be low quality and the entire thing was doughy and apparently undercooked. 

I'm not sure if the ownership changed at some point since I last visited, but in the direction they're headed, it should. At the very least, a Kitchen Nightmares visit from Chef Ramsay is in order.
author: aaron f.

description: My sister has ordered from Haystacks at least 5x a week (delivery).  She gives delivery person nice gratuity.  One would think Haystacks would appreciate loyal customer, right?  That IS how businesses continue, thrive, no? One would go further to say returning customers provide security for sustained profitability.  My sweet sister was told by the snarky woman who has taken her order THAT SHE ORDERS TOO MUCH.  TOO OFTEN.  Finally, she would no longer honor her orders.  There is no backstory to this.  She had no debt outstanding.  She ordered from her neighborhood eatery.  She has no car and mobility problems.  The ACLU, KGO, and BBB all informed and investigating.
author: Eileen D.

description:
I have been going to Haystack for years.  The pizza is very good, generous toppings and fresh. I recommend trying other dishes on their menu though. The calamari is as good as North Beach Restaraunts. Pasta and  Chicken dishes are yummy, particularly like the ravioli. 
 
The surf and turf was okay- the steak perfect, the surf just ok and again generous portions of vegetables and sides. They also make one of the best hamburgers in the city.  The Alibaba burger is outstanding! The classic - excellent with  Salad, Fries or Spaghetti - all a good compliment to the burger. 

Whether we go in to dine, order by phone or online, the staff is friendly and acommodating.  Ordered online for the first time delivery was within 30 minutes and the food hot.
author: Janet C.

description:
I finally ventured into this place for a sit down, eye-talian style dinner with my bff. I was dumb for not paying closer attention to the prices on the menu... we ordered one spaghetti w/balls and one cheese ravioli w/meat sauce, one garden salad to split, one root beer that came to me flat and a garlic bread that arrived after we nearly finished our meal. The bill came to a whopping $48. What the heck!?!

Perhaps if this wasn't a meal we could have gotten at the Stonestown food court for less than half the price... maybe if my raviolis arrived hot rather than barely defrosted... sigh. At those prices, at least make some effort to fool me into thinking this is fresh-made fare.

In addition, the place could use some sprucing up (dust on the plastic grape vines), and they should lose the assault of country top-40 on the radio blasting in the background. 

Although the staff was pretty friendly, they hovered immediately after the bill came (the place was almost empty), asking repeatedly if we were ready to pay. Perhaps they suspected we would run after seeing the check? 

The prices match the neighborhood but not the food, decor or service. You're better off at Pasta Pomodoro up the street or Twin Peaks Pizza just around the bend.
author: Prattle P.

description:
I think this place is exactly what it aspires to be. A simple family-run neighborhood restaurant.

The food and the service are OK. The prices match the location and the entire proposition. The decor is less than contemporary and certainly not hip.

I don't understand some of the bad reviews here. If you want to go to a nice trendy restaurant with superb service and creative food, go downtown and pay top dollar. If you are just hungry, in the neiborhood, and craving some famly style pizza, stop by.
author: Jose S.

description:
I've only ever had pizza at Haystack so I can't speak upon the entrees.  I've had the Haystack, Zorba the Greek, Luigi the Italian, the New Yorker and the Alexander.  All are top notch, and super flavorful.  The all veggie pizzas look so delicious but I always end up choosing the reliable Alexander.

I prefer to have this pizza at the restaurant so that its hot out of the oven.  Sometimes, when delivered the crust can get a bit soggy, maybe from sitting while deliveries are being made.  However, the crust is so good, crisp and chewy.  Not too thick.  It's even better the next day, cold.

The antipasto salad is one of the best i've had at a pizza place.  It is completely loaded with meats, cheese and an array of veggies.  They have a creamy italian dressing that is very good too.

I've referred plenty of people to Haystack and none has been disappointed yet.  Give it a try!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
GREAT service at lunch!!

I first went to Haystack at 3 years old,  no joke, we grew up in Noe Valley and Haystack was a hit back then...
Still is.   If you appreciate old school gems, down home service, good quality meats, veggies, salads, generous portions if that's your thing, head over. 

I typically don't do pizza for lunch or all that frequently so when I do, it best be a good one.  Went here with my younger brother for lunch and it hit the spot.  He enjoyed some meatball sandwich and I had a yummy salad and a personal pizza.  
Noteworthy: they have whole wheat crust as an option. Is 'OhHellYa' a word?  Word.

Worth a solid 5 because not every place needs to be gourmet and frou-frou to deserve a 5.  No complaints, ever.  Some of these reviews are way off.  

very reasonable - $20 for 2.
author: Athena S.

description: When I placed my order, I was told that they would deliver within 45 to 60 minutes.  75 minutes later I called to see where they were, they apologize and said the driver would be there within 5 minutes, and would throw in a couple free desserts.  15 minutes later, I called again, and was again told 5 minutes, and free dessert.  10 minutes after that, they showed up with a cold pizza and no dessert.  The pizza wasn't bad, but the service was horrible.  Never going to get delivery from this again! PS, it was $80 for three pizzas!
author: Alex G.

description:
5:23 Ordered 2 salads, a soda and a dessert through Grub Hub. 
6:52 Called to see where food was at. Immediately put on hold after I asked where it           was. Held for 6 minutes and finally hung up.
7:00 Called back, immediately put on hold. Girl came back on, identified myself as previous caller. Received a very short "we are trying to call the driver if you would just hold on". Ooookaaayy...  Finally comes back on and says driver should be there in 5 minutes and tries to hang up. I asked her when the order went out originally. Received a very short "it didn't, I thought it had but it didn't so we just made you new ones"He's just leaving now. What? Made it while you had me waiting on hold? Not even giving me the option of just canceling the order? Without an apology or sorry for the inconvenience? At this point, I said "Thanks for saying sorry!" She responded with "your welcome". I asked for her name and she hung up on me.
7:20ish driver shows up, immediately begins to say it isn't his fault. I said don't worry about it, you've  already received your tip. (I had included tip with payment online.) He starts asking if I want him to just take the food back and swings it out of arms reach. I said no, it's already been paid for. He repeats and I finally get it through his head that I have been charged on my card already and I want the 2 salads that have taken 2 hours to get.  He leaves but I find later where he  tossed his crumpled receipt on my front steps. Very professional!
I have been a very loyal customer since I moved to Noe Valley in the late 90's. Unfortunately, all it takes is one bad experience and lack of accountability to lose a good customer forever. 

2 stars for past experience. They threw a couple extra sodas and an extra dessert in I guess as an apology.  (Allergic to chocolate by the way!) An actual acknowledgement or apology would have gone so much farther to saving the situation. And maybe some additional customer service training.
 The fact that I see so many bad reviews here and nothing seems to be done about fixing the issues leads me to believe the owners just don't care anymore. So sad. I really liked this place.
author: L A.

description:
Not every restaurant is going to be a perfect 5 stars from every single customer or not every restaurant is going to be a 1 star failure from every customer. Everyone has their good experiences and bad experiences in places that everyday at everyplace by everybody is not going to be the same. Otherwise the world won't be ahead as well as us.
