I went there with my family because I have not been there for years. It was very busy due to the New Years Eve and I only see one waiter that did a excellent job on his own handling multiple customers and tables. The food was good that I forgot how good the pizza was and my customer service experience there was unforgettable. I will go there again.
author: C G.

description: I went here for a friends birthday party, I liked the neighborhood it was in and the wait staff seemed really nice.  The pizza was really good.  I was shocked. I never expected such good pizza at this place.  My reason for being there was for a party, but if you can find time to go and enjoy the pizza without the distraction of a pizza on the head (long story), you will be pleased with the pizza at this place.
author: Gregory E.

description:
I needed pizza on the fly. This was the most convenient place. Had passed by this place a million times and finally this was the opportune moment. The front room was not filled, however  they seated us in the very back room. 

      We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was very good. Light and crispy topped with a sprinkle of parsley. Unfortunately, no spiders, just rings. Delicious though. It was not oily. We had a medium double mushroom wheat pizza. It was an easy order. Nothing complicated or high maintenance about our order. It was a slightly softer dough and a little thicker than I expected, but  not bad. In  cases like that,  I usually save my crust  for later snacking so that I can have an extra slice more. 

     Over all the food was satisfying, but the service was HORRIBLE !!!!!!! We had our order taken, and our food was served in a timely manner, but our waitress did not check up on us during our meal if we needed anything extra. I had to go up to the front room myself to ask for oregano which I usually sprinkle on before consuming my pizza. 

     Our  pizza plates were cleared after we were obviously finished which happened quicker than we were offered a refill of water, which never happen at all,  yet we still hadn't finished our calamari. My fork was still hand , and while in the process of polishing off the rest of the calamari,  our waitress came, assumed that  we were done and without asking quickly took away the plate I was working on. 

     Now, I was obviously speechless that  this just happened.  I mean it was only about five pieces that I was slowly working on but we just let that go. Why? Because not only were we  so stunned that it all happened so quickly, but today would have not been the time to mess with a woman who had just had worked through a tough week at work.  Deadlines and all . And  to top it off it was that time of the month and not worth starting my weekend by slaying the dragon over this minor hiccup!  

     It was not as if they were so busy that they had no time to ask if we were finished even if there were just a couple pieces of calamari left. She just up and cleared the plates  so fast that it completely overshadowed the fact that we had not even been checked up on during our meal for even a refill of water or for any other request that we may have had. What's up with that? (Don't sweat the small stuff, right?" ) AS A PAYING CUSTOMER, I HATE BEING RUSHED BEFORE, DURING, OR AFTER MY MEAL !!!!!!!!!!! Oh yeah, but she did ask if we wanted to look at the dessert menu. The audacity !!!!! 

    Needless to say, we won't be coming back to this place because I can get better service elsewhere, where I can relax, have a fantastic dinner AND dessert,  and know that I'll be taken care of after a hard week's work because I deserve it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Plus I'll make sure to look at the wine list first ;  )  

     Experience can sometimes be bad, but more often than not it's usually good for me. This was just one of those fluke ones. Life goes on and tomorrow, as those weird Christians are trying to proclaim that the world will end anyways, I will never have to worry about bad service again because I signed up for Nirvana!
author: Granolia G.

description:
Holy Pizza, 'Zorba The Greek!' 

It's rare that pizza delights me the way the #4 at Haystack does. It has everything I enjoy on a pie, and it tastes even better on the second day! This place isn't 'bells and whistles' but that's what I enjoy about it! When I walk in, I know I can grab a table, order a pie, and enjoy some down time with friends. They have a diverse menu, but I stick to the same every time: #3 or #4. I'm sort-of excited to venture out and try the others... but sometimes, you just want what you know works! So if you're looking for something robust and delish, try the 'Zorba.'
author: Andrew C.

description:
No idea what's wrong with some of the reviewers here. This is good old fashioned pizza parlor pizza that's as rare in San Francisco as a concealed carry permit.

Their dough isn't artisanal whole wheat flour grown from the tears of rescued pandas on a rooftop garden. Their toppings and sauce are high quality but traditional; if you want truffle oil and purple potato pizzas, this place isn't for you.

If you want cold-damp-night comfort food pizza, this is nearly as good as it gets in NorCal.

Note: the service can be slow, but I'd only be deducting a star or two if there were 10 available for this pizza. Since there aren't, 5 will do.
author: Geoff F.

description:
I emerged from my office Friday night at 6:00, the earliest I had left the office since....well, probably February.  I wish I was joking when I said that.  When I left the office, I had a standing appointment to return the next morning at 9:30, bright and early, to spend another weekend feeding the monster.  By Friday at midnight, after an 18-month wrestling match, the monster appeared defeated or placated.  Take your pick.  Result's the same, either way.

Saturday came and it was almost too breathtaking beautiful to actually enjoy or believe.  Perfection whispers illusion in this day and age, and I spent the whole day walking on eggshells, expecting a call that would drag me back to the office, never to return.

By Sunday, my frayed nerves relaxed just enough to allow me to climb the vast hill to the summit of Noe Valley, and then to collapse in a booth at Haystack Pizza and proceed to eat and drink.  I cannot comment on their sandwiches or pasta, for Wifey and I split a small pepperoni, sausage, olive, and onion pizza, and it was fantastic.  The service was friendly and attentive, the setting was quaint without being too over-the-top, and the price was nothing to complain about.

But what now for our hero?  [Or, at least, for me?]  Will he be summoned back to the cave of eternal struggle, therein to waste the remainder of his summer in the battle of the stupid versus the evil?  Will he once again disappear from Yelp, with nary a fan or friend to notice or miss him?  Will he discover The Penguin's evil plot in time?  [Sorry, pretty much had to throw that one in.]  Only time will tell, only time will tell.
author: Ben P.

description: I am a Noe Valley native--edderhave not ordered a pizzas from there in over 20 yrs Yesterday I ordered a lg pizza with pepporoni. The last piece was as good as the first My Dad ask me to order one for him tonight. Thats rare. Great pizza,
author: Donovan M.

description:
I really enjoyed Haystack and I think this has now officially becoming my pizza hangout in Noe Valley. 

Cleopatra w/ Pesto was good (you could have gotten this with Tomato Sauce if you wanted) and was decently sized, the small easily takes care of 2 people. The Medium will handle 3 for sure. I'm not sure on the other sizes as I tried to peek around at other tables but no one had anything bigger than a Medium.

I loved the casual laid back atmosphere and it's a lot bigger than I expected as it's a deep restaurant. There's seating past the bar area
author: Eric A.

description: guys... i don't really post here in yelp. but this time i have to.. i just ordered food from them for delivery. and while eating the steamed vegetables i found worm in my food. i posted 3 pictures of it.
author: Hazel C.

description:
3 stars because they're open late.

2 if they weren't.

Food was okay. I had the baked pasta and caesar salad. I definitely wasn't wow-ed.

I know it was a warm day for sf, but I was sweating more than a hooker in church. Not comfortable, let me tell you.

But, they do have diet sprite!!! I don't hate it!
author: Marisa R.

description:
Mmmmmm! Haystack is pretty good pizza. They use lots of garlic and the large size is actually a hefty portion. I had a pineapple pizza with my boy during my visit. We both enjoyed our slices thoroughly and proceeded across the street after wards for more beers at the Dubliner. 

However, if you were doing carry out at Haystack they have a bar inside too. This location seemed to be family/kid-friendly and low key. I think think their prices are a tad high, but that seems to be the case at all pizza joints in the bay area. At least the ones I have come across.
author: Nichole P.

description:
YAY, Surfen Turf, and in the 'hood.   .   .

FLAG 4 Redux!/  LATE NIGHT!!  da Kine da Vinci

Thx, Marisa!
author: Clifford L.

description:
My Favorite restaurant in San Francisco. 
I've been a regular for 13 years

Atmosphere:
It's simple. It's Homey. It's casual. The low-profile atmosphere doesn't offer a clue as to he high-impact taste and service you'll receive here. 

Service:
Never had I had to wait for seating. Their staff are all friendly, courteous and prompt. Their service is very good. They deliver your orders within reasonable times. Drinks 3-5 min, Appetizers and Salads 5-7 min.'s, And entree's within 10-17(most). 
They check back on you to make sure you are ok. And they are mindful of where you are in your dining experience: refills, extra items, plate removal, desert offers and check delivery.

To-go food is accompanied by items your may need, and is promptly made and well packaged. 

Delivery service is prompt, easy and friendly.

Food/Beverages.
Nice Wine selection. 
Size-able non-alcoholic beverage selection. 
There really is something on the menu for everyone of all diets (yes vegetarians have AMPLE choices) and all ages.
I've brought dates, anniversary parties, birthday parties, young nieces, nephews, young and older adults. And all have been very satisfied. 
Now, I've never had a pizza here. My family has, I've sampled it, it was good. But what really makes this place STAND OUT are their OTHER menu items: Chicken Cordon Bleu (my favorite), eggplant parmesan, veal parmesan (both also VERY good), pestos, alfredos, marinaras, a wide array of pastas, lentils, vegetables, and other sides and much more. 

Money: average dinner plate for 2 ~ $30 drinks and meal included.
author: Miguel R.

description:
This place is mediocre at best. I had heard good things about the place.. The pizza i got was under cooked. The ingredients were bad quality and there was way too much garlic. Why do they put garlic on all their pizzas? They claim to be "traditional Italian fare", an italiano would not be best pleased!
but other than that it was great, haha
author: Kieran F.

description:
I love this place and although their pizza is not the BEST in sf, it has the flavor you learn to love and miss.  

However - I must say, that I had my husband pick up a SMALL cesar, order of mozzarella sticks and two diet cokes last night, and it was $25!!!  I emailed him today thinking there must be a mistake, and he told me the diet cokes were $2.75 each - that is crazy.  We ordered Paxti's the weekend before and our whole medium pizza was $23.50.
author: B H.

description: I LOVE Haystack. Super delicious pizza. I love it. Friendly service. I'm confused why there's even negative reviews. I've been here several times and the food has never let me down. I like the guy who's always there, he's very accomodating.
author: Gina D.

description: We placed today a large order of 3 XLarge pizzas for our school Teachers Appreciattion day lunch, almost a $100 order, and the pizzas arrived not only soggy and cold but all smashed up, a total wreck. We called right away to report the desaster and the manager offered to send a second order but it would take another hour for us to get it. Short of time, we declined and asked for a discount on the whole order but were turnt down... The lunch was ruined because of their reckless delivery driver. I guess our school will not order from them again.
author: coco r.

description:
I actually left really happy and surprised at how good the pizza here was! I was STUFFED coming into this place, thinking MAYBE I'd eat a slice, or nibble on one slice of pizza. I was so so full. Once the pizza came though, omg, 2 slices magically disappeared.

Two of us ordered The Cleopatra - grilled eggplant, sun dried tomatoes, garlic, pesto, feta cheese. WOW. Delicious. We ordered the small, which came with 8 slices! The hugest small pizza I've ever seen.

That's all I tried, but it was enough to get me wanting to come back again. Service was cool too.
author: Carol L.

description:
Well, I have been waiting on this review. I do kinda rely on Yelp for trying new places... That said... It was New Years Eve. My dinning partner and myself were looking for a good pizza. NOT just a slice, but a whole pie. We decided on hitting up Noe Valley. It had been awhile since I strolled up and down 24th Street, so we popped into Haystack.

I know, I know... Maybe New Years Eve isn't the best time to give my two cents, but the place wasn't that busy. (hmmm, maybe a bad sign) We stood at the door for a few minutes, then went up to the bar and explained that we wanted to eat. We were seated fairly quickly then... Again, they weren't busy. (The SFPD were being treated pretty good though)
About 15 minutes later, we flagged down a server. She said she was sorry. "No big woop" we say, as we are pretty hungry at this point (feed me, it's already 7:00 p.m.) The pizza arrived fairly quickly though. At this point, I figured I could eat anything.... 
No bueno! Flavorless and wet is how I would describe it. 

It's a shame, as this place couldn't be in busier neighborhood.
I am pretty sure it's been there for quite sometime. 
They may want to come up with some new recipes?  ;0/
author: John R.

description: Never tried eating in their restaurant but my uncles would always have their pepperoni pizza delivered at least once a week and I don't understand what exactly they find appealing in Haystack pizza.  The crust is too thick, the topping is way too salty as in waaaaaaay too salty and it's just too greasy for me.  Really, I need to be enlightened because I really don't like it no matter how hungry I am....the first bite makes me wanna gag.
author: Janis P.

description:
Haystack pizza is fine if you're in the neighborhood.  I wouldn't call myself a pizza snob, but for me, Haystack pizza is just a quick option for pick-up or delivery.  

Honestly though, I can't give it more than average rating because it tastes like any other pizza and it's kind of expensive.

Salads far outshine the pizza as far as I'm concerned :(
author: Angella S.

description:
Super cute restaurant. The staff was very friendly and immediately made us feel welcome. We arrived really hungry and ordered the pepperoni rolls and a hawaiian pizza. I really liked the pizza but I'm from Chicago so I like a thicker crust pizza. This had a thicker, softer crust which I really like. The pepperoni rolls were heavy and could have been a meal in itself. We left with a half of a pizza for leftovers.
I'll go back.
author: Eliz M.

description:
2 stars because the server was pretty nice, even though he was an awful server.

No stars for the food, which was just awful.  And it came out so fast, even though we had told the server we wanted to take our time.  It was like wham bam eat and scram.

No more for me.
author: Theresa H.

description: Kitchen staff obviously do not wash their hands, as my fiance' and I both had separate dishes, and both got violently ill shortly after eating here. Totally grossed out? You should be. Keep walking.
author: Vincent C.

description: Another decent pizza joint, although for the price I would go for Patxi's or Little Star, the Calzone was okay but I had the New York Style Pizza and they did a pretty good job! Another one between 3/4 staff was really friendly!
author: Tiff W.

description:
I don't know there is just something inviting about this place. It has some old school New York pizza shop charm to it. I want to go in one night and sit at the little bar and order myself a pint of beer while I wait for my take out pizza. It has a cozy feel to it. 

We had a small onion, meatball and extra cheese. I was told it would be about 20 minutes and bang on it was! I was afraid about getting the extra cheese because I didn't want it to be disgusting but my partner insisted. Well it did have extra but the perfect amount. I also thought it was cooked to perfection! The crust was the right crispiness and the sauce just the right amount of sweetness. I do hope they make the sauce themselves and it is not out of a bit #10 can, but if it is I loved it just the same. 

I read someone else review about delivery. I am embarrassed to admit I live up the street and sometime ago it was pouring rain and we had it delivered. I should have just gotten wet and gone out and done the dirty deed on my own. What I ordered ended up taking forever and I do remember something was missing. We just said screw it, that is the price we get for being lazy! 

Good pizza, good staff, cozy atmosphere!
author: Scott P.

description:
DO NOT, I repeat, do NOT order food delivery from this place. 

They have great sandwiches that lure me back after an imposed hiatus, and they fuck it up every. single. time. They cannot manage to bring us the right thing.

The last two times we have gotten delivery we have gotten someone else's dinner. When we called to tell them they said, "want to just eat that?" Um no, or I would not have called you.

It happened again tonight. Driver just picked up the food we did not order and left us foodless. He said he'd be back in 5. It has been 10.

It has now been an hour and fifteen minutes since we ordered. Presumably someone else is waiting on food we had our hands on.

Terrible.
author: Brittney G.

description: The pizza is really delicious, the ambiance is cute and romantic, however; the customer service isn't so great. Out of the three different servers I had that night only one of them actually talked and made eye contact. It made the experience very awkward. We also had to get up and hunt down a waiter at one point to get a refill on our drinks.
author: Lissette V.

description: First time here for dinner with friend and girlfriend. Inside feel warm, staff was friendly. They have a good portion size salad Cesar dressing $10. Man entrée we order was their spaghetti with mean ball, good size dish, sauce was good and meatball good size delicious. Food was good and made with love. They busy during dinner time, small restaurant but food and price was worth it. If you love Italian food recommend it and would come back here
author: Gruber T.

description:
She had me at Heart. The bartender, a young woman, was bopping around to Heart, playing on the stereo. I was waiting for a friend. Forever, it seemed. I commented on how much I appreciated hearing Heart. She had just discovered them and was now going to go out and buy more! How cute. I gave her my recommendations, of course.

The food was good. The beer is cold. They did a lot of to go orders as I waited, so I knew people liked the place. I would certainly eat here again and again.
author: Penguin S.

description:
We have ordered pizza from Haystack for the past year, probably 5-10 times.  The first few times the pizza was great: hot, delicious, made well, affordable.  The last 3 times, however, well.....let's just say we will NEVER order from them again.  

Long story short three pizza's ago, the pizza arrived made to order, however it was room temperature (okay, car temperature.)  Okay, this happens.  I can forgive it.  We just popped it in the oven, reheated it, and it was fine.  Two pizza's ago, we ordered it late on a Tuesday night (that happened to be my birthday), I placed the order at about 7:30, was told it would take an 45-60 minutes.  I lost track of time, my boyfriend yells down to me, "Did the pizza get here yet?"  and I realize it's now 8:45, and no pizza.  Hmmm.... I waited another 15 minutes and just as I was dialing Haystack to find out where the hell our pizza is, the driver knocks on the door (at 9:00 p.m.).  He handed me the pizza, and I told him to wait, I placed my hand on the bottom of the box, and lo and behold, it was cold (not even room temperature.)  I asked the driver who could I call to complain to, and the driver offered over and over that he could take it back and have a new one made.  Right, because everyone likes to eat pizza at 10 pm on a Tuesday night.  That's a certain recipe for indigestion.  No thanks.  I called and spoke to the manager (possibly owner?) who apologized profusely, and put a note in our address that our next pizza was free.  Wow, thank you!

That brings us to last night, where we ordered our final pizza EVER from Haystack.  I called, placed the order, and the guy who answered the phone asked me why we had the free pizza, and I told him, "Because the last two we ordered were cold and/or late."  So, was it unreasonable for me to expect that my pizza would come piping hot this time?  That maybe, people would pay special attention to our order in an attempt to correct the past two wrongs?  Apparently, it was.  The pizza arrived in a fairly timely manner (60 minutes), and SHOCKER!  It    was      cold.       Again.  So, we're done.  I'd rather eat greasy Pizza Hut or flavorless Dominoes, or even overpriced Round Table!  At least they come hot!  Save yourself the trouble.  If you really want Haystack Pizza, go into the restaurant and eat it there.  That's probably the only way it'll get to you hot.
author: Priscilla D.

description:
Antipasto salad wasA-MAZING! Small portion will feed 2 even 3 people! It was super w/ mozzarella, pepperonchinis, and everything else! YUM!

Then i had the chicken parmigiana and the portion was huge! Yes, i tried to eat it all and got sick when i got home from over-eating.

There is nothing gourmet here. It is a lot of full fat, full size bad for you but good for your soul kinda food. I say, treat yourself to an antipasto salad for sure , then share a meal or pizza.

Cute little place in Noe Valley. Open 'til 11 pm or midnight (weekends).
author: C A.

description:
All my classic Italian favorites located in one place! 

Dont:
Judge them based on their dark, ugly, outdated decor.

Do: 
Judge them based on the taste/quality their food, which are all very reasonably priced! 

Don't:
Drink the water here. It tastes like toilet water. 

Do:
Splurge the extra $2 for a flat soda.

Dont:
Order the calamari. Even though its breaded, the tentacles are so big and it has that slimy aftertaste like day-old sushi. 

Do: 
Dine-in because their delivery service is slow.

Don't: 
Waste all your money feeding the parking meter on the street. 

Do:
Try one of their pizza's. Great ratio of meat, sauce, crust. A lot better than other pizza joints I've been to.

Don't: 
Forget to order caesar salad. It's fresh and cold, plus the croutons appear crunchy and freshly toasted to order.

Do:
Skip the house salad. It looks old and gross.

In short, you'll be glad you tried their pizza. They also have surf & turf items like new york steak, seared scallops, grilled prawns, etc. Oh and the tiramisu...
author: Joraine C.

description:
The pizzas good but I lve round table better surprisingly I though it would be a restaurant based around their pizza, but the menu was huge maybe not such a good thing for most restaurants I didn't like it to much. I traveled to get here from across the bay it wasent worth my drive.

Not a fan of the prices there a little high, and if im going to pay for a pricy dinner I want a good meal and excellent service, the waiters seemed a little snobbish and did little work and expected a big tip. It might just be me but im not for that or people being fake to work for a tip, I want a genuine person who is interested in my order and food quality.

If they fixed a few things I think it would be better.
author: Ash S.

description:
This place used to be great. My boyfriend and I would order the New Yorker with pepperoni at least once a week. But not anymore.

Last week I was gone and he ordered delivery. It came after an hour (which isn't too unexpected), but it was cold and smashed all to one side, hardly recognizable as pizza. He called and complained and the manager said he noted the account and next time we ordered, they'd provide some reconciliation.

Well, last night we decided to try again. The peace offering for the f-ed up pizza was $5 off, which I guess puts something of a dent considering how costly Haystack can be. Only tonight when the pizza arrived, again it was cold. Not "cold", but definitely not hot and barely lukewarm. The cheese had reformed and wasn't really melted anymore. It was another major letdown.

Haystack is so expensive it should be really good to be worth it, but I'm done paying $30 to have cold pizza delivered to me.

I won't order delivery from Haystack ever again. Maybe I'll eat there if I find myself in Noe Valley some time.
author: Garrett O.

description: Delicious pizza, friendly people, cheap pitchers of good beer. A little tired inside, but it has great character!
author: James C.

description: greasy, floppy, tasty.  I ordered the wrong pie once, totally my fault.  They just made the right one for me and didnt charge me for the one i didnt want/couldnt eat.  so nice.
author: David S.

description:
I'm a pizza snob.  I don't like pineapple on a pizza, I don't think chicken is good either. If I want to eat chicken, I'll go to a place that serves chicken. Pineapple is great for dessert, not on my pizza...

I walked a few blocks to go to this place and I have to say, I'm glad I did.  One of my BIG tests is if the stuff on top STAYS on top of the slice when I pick it up. This place passes, easily.

I ordered to go and they have a small bar to sit at while you wait.  I noticed several families there, but I felt sorry for the couples that had to sit near the loud kids.  Due to its small size, I'd say this is not a place for kids...

I'm going back and I think that's the ultimate compliment.
author: Mac S.

description: I live near Haystack and have heard from many locals about the great pizza here and how it's been a staple to Noe Valley for years. I can't seem to understand why this place is still in business. The staff is off and seems very "special." They can't seem to get simple orders correct and are very off putting. The pizza is sub par, greasy and stale. I'd go to Whole Foods and get all the ingredients to make my own before ever making the mistake of eating here.
author: Fiona N.

description: Growing up in Noe Valley there were places that loomed large in my imagination. Places I couldn't wait set foot in again. Bud's Ice Cream, Color Crane, Castro Pharmacy, Bell Market & Haystack Pizza. Of these, only Haystack Pizza survives today. And they still have a great pizza. I always get pepperoni & mushroom. Best pie in Noe Valley.
author: Cesar C.

description:
The husband and I decided to spend a lovely Saturday evening strolling around Noe Valley, Christmas shopping and enjoying ourselves - before we got started we chose a spot to fill our bellies. 

Haystack looked nice. We were in the mood for italian - so after a check of the menu we went inside.  We were the only table in the place - which was fine, but maybe we should have taken that as a sign. We ordered a pizza that sounded similar to my husband's favorite - no sauce, basil, fresh cheese, diced tomato. sounds yummy right?

It got to our table and looked delicious - but the minute we started eating we looked at each other and realized we'd made a big mistake - The crust was so so soggy  - and super garlicky (it didn't mention garlic in the description).  It was impossible to eat with your hands - fork and knife were mandatory and it was just overall... gross. It was like eating pizza mush.

We each tried to eat enough to feel like we'd gotten our moneys worth - but it was just bad. So bad in fact, that it put my hubs in quite the mood and he spent the rest of what was supposed to be a lovely trip pointing out all of the other restaurants we should have eaten at instead.

They also overcharged him on the beer he ordered - but whatever, we weren't going to dispute it - we just wanted to get the hell out of there. You win some, you lose some.

and haystack was a big fat LOSE for us.
author: Melissa J.

description:
One of the worst pizzas of my life.  We got a medium "Old McDonald" last night - Marinated chicken, fresh garlic, onions, mushrooms & fresh tomato.  We also added fresh basil for $1.90 and got thin crust.  Pizza base was so soggy we couldn't even pick up a piece and the "fresh basil" was wilted and gross.

We got a regular salad as well, nothing bad about it and we ate it all as the pizza was terrible.

$29 for the pizza, salad and tax - WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY

Positives - could order on line and that was quick.  Delivery took 45 Min's which was good (though we live in the neighborhood).
author: ORLA L.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco without  a doubt. I've been going here since I was a little kid and the pizza has never changed. Its nice to know Haystack is still around even with all the changes in the neighborhood these days. If you don't feel like ordering a whole pizza or spending too much money, then just check out the personal pizzas on the menu!
author: Matthew F.

description:
This is definitely a place for cheesy plain-jane pepperoni-mushroom pizza when you're tired of the foodie yuppie stuff. Waitstaff is friendly. We ordered a pizza to go around 11:30am and had it in 15 minutes.

The guy in the corner starting on a pitcher of beer seemed kind of out of place for what is turning out to be a Noe Valley stroller-packed Sunday afternoon on 24th Street ...
author: Rob T.

description:
The Haystack Pizza is located in the main street of Noe Valley and is a very interesting Italian restaurant.

The place is divided in two different areas. The first room (the one you see once you get in) is open and offer a bar counter. The second room (which can be accessed by going through the first one) is more cozy and less open. It is actually perfect if you would like more intimacy as well as great and comfy seating (they basically have wall seat).

Prices are good and the staff was nice (out waitress was a bit overwhelmed though). A good surprise was to have a chance to talk talk with the owner of the place who was checking upon is if everything was fine.

We've ordered a pizza by choosing our own toping. The crust was definitely a favorite for me (see my reco below) and the overall result was tasty. (Their Small [12''] = 8 slices, Medium [14''] = 10 slices, Large [16']) = 12 slices. They even have a "Wagon Wheel"! [18''])

We were looking for something new in Noe Valley and the Haystack Pizza restaurant is a very affordable option that offers a great atmosphere and good pizza.

==============================

Pros:
- Atmosphere.
- Price
- Various range of items on their menu (pizza, pasta, salad...)

Cons:
- None.

Cedric's secret advice:
 - best time of the day to go there and avoid the crowd? 7pm on a Friday night was still a good time to get seating. However plan to come early if you come numerous.
 - best spot to take a picture? Look close to the bar on your way out and stop by the wooden man with the cowboy hat at that a shot ;)
 - best pizza size? The small (12 inches) is definitely a lot for me. It is perfect to share!

Cedric's favorite options:
 - Wheat dough pizza with their think crust is really great.
 - Go adventurous and make your own pizza!
author: Cedric L.

description:
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 3/5
Wait: 2.5/5
Price: $$
Presentation of food: 3/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3.5/5
Overall: 3/5

i dont really like their pizza here nor their pasta, but their cheesy garlic  bread is pretty good. the only reason i come here is because the boyfriend use to love this place.
author: Eva H.

description: Since I moved to Noe Valley, Haystack has always been my go-to takeout establishment for pizza -- and when I have eaten at the restaurant, the service has always been pleasant.  The pizza itself is tasty (and fillling) -- good cheese, flavorful sauce, and best of all, not too greasy. As an added bonus -- though it pains me to own up publicly to my laziness -- they deliver quickly. Well done!
author: Katie M.

description:
I've eaten here more times than a prostie performs fellatio.  

When I first started going, I would order an array of vegetarian pizzas that were all quite good.

But then, one day, whilst feeling frisky, I ordered the New Yorker.  Hot damn!  Best pizza I've had stateside.  

To accompany the pizza, I would recommend the barrel of beer.  Yesh, barrel, bitches!

The place itself is classy, especially after one of these barrels.  By this, of course, I mean endearingly tacky. 

(And, uh, the review below this might be a little harsh (and incoherent?))
author: Christine M.

description:
I tried them in a desparate search for anything NOT pizza or chinese that I could have delivered to my lazy ass. So far its the absolute best ravioli, fresh baked bread, fried scallops and perfectly cooked vegtables I have ever tried anywhere. The food is always piping hot and the sodas feel like they could have just come out of a freezer... plus they have Coke, not Pepsi-(my #1 rule) and best of all- you can order online. A++++ [I didn't see thier website posted here but I didn't really look too hard either.. just in case, its http://www.haystackpizza.com

**update** --these people won't deliver to me now that I don't live in Dolores heights. So their 5 stars goes down to 2.  Seriously, If you're not going to prevent me from having to get dressed and go outside, then you suck as a restaurant.

**re-update**  i cant believe i gave  them two stars... and im not just saying that cause i live in an area they deliver to again.  that part is just coincidence, it really is awesome food. the garlic mashed potatoes are probably the best ive ever had.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Disappointingly average pizza and sub-optimal service. The salad was topped with un-ripe tomatoes and filled with inedible bits of lettuce. The garlic bread was good and garlic-y, but it arrived 45 seconds before the pizza. 

The pizza itself was OK, and that's a pretty damning statement given how much I love pizza. The sauce tasted canned, there was too much cheese, and three hours later I'm still getting "bonus love" from the sausage.

Regardless of how "intimate" a restaurant is, I can't stand wait staff who stick their butt in your face for five minutes while they take the order from the table next door. Seriously, can't you see I'm having a hard enough time eating as it is?

Couple all of that with the fact that our waitress had to be prompted to refill our waters and reminded to take our payment and, to quote the Who, we won't be fooled again.
author: Greg Q.

description: You usually can't go wrong the pizzas here. I typically order pretty straight-forward stuff: 1-2 toppings like cheese or pepperoni, and it gets the job done. We ordered one of the specials one time and that was pretty good too. The other items like pasta or salad are so-so. I had the spaghetti with meatballs once and it wasn't terrible but made me wish I got a pizza instead. So...go here for the pizza!
author: Jordan P.

description:
Haystack is where I go in the hood when I want to load up on carbs and get a nice creamy pint of ranch dressing to dip my head in. When I go here, I feel like I'm transported back in time and place to my smallish midwestern hometown circa 1985. And sometimes that's just what I'm in the mood for. The decor is pretty wacky -- the front half is kind of western themed, with a big Native American vibe, and the back half feels kind of like a greek themed restaurant to me. The music is pretty bad, but can make for some good sing alongs and air guitar moments. The menu has various fried appetizer offerings, salads, pastas, pizzas, etc. 

To me, Haystack is not great, but sometimes I don't want great. I just want to go somewhere comfortable and unpretentious where me and my old man can get all bloated on dough and cheese and pitchers of beer. Mmm, sexy beasts!
author: Pam D.

description: I've been to Haystack many times over the years, and ordered takeout many more.    It's a great traditional pizza parlor, no more, no less.  Haystack makes excellent sausage and vegetarian pizzas, but I usually end up ordering the New Yorker, my all-time favorite.   Their house salad is an extremely generous mediterranean salad.  The decor is faux saloon, but that's part of the charm.  And if you're coming with a group they have plenty of tables big enough for 6 to 8.
author: Anne C.

description:
Have you ever had somebody walk into your office at like 4pm, when you've already shifted into neutral to coast through the rest of the day? And they hand you some new task AND want to be chatty? Doesn't that suck? Well, that's what EIGHT of us did to the staff at Haystack last night. Our booze-fueled book club adjourned from the noisy bar where we'd discussed the book and came here for much-needed food. Not surprisingly, we were in the very back of the narrow, two-room restaurant at the only table that could accommodate us.

Despite the location, the service was excellent and friendly. They didn't even harass us for talking loudly about words that sound dirty but aren't (circumscribe, dictation, comeuppance, masticate, etc.),  I still feel a bit sorry for the little old ladies two tables away though. I'm sure they considered us hooligans.

The two pizzas we got were quite good, with no shortage of toppings and enough cheese to hold them in place. Beer is available by the pint, the pitcher, and the KEG! Before you get as excited as I did, their "keg" is only 10 oz. larger than the pitcher. They also have a fairly nice wine list, and of course the normal array of soft drinks.

In the end, we were all happy and satisfied, and we even cajoled our waitress into sampling a bite of the bacon-chocolate bar one person brought for dessert!
author: Bill B.

description:
The pizza is unremarkable but decently tasty, holding some middle ground of crustiness between New York style and Chicago style, without venturing into the gourmet realm of California style. The decor reminds me of Howdy Doody, in a way that would be mockable if you didn't feel affectionately towards the place. 

...which brings me to today. There's a dearth of places in San Francisco that deliver -- most delivery places are the kind of thick, doughy crust pizza that's really only good when bought by the slice at 2:30am. But I remembered Haystack as being ok, and placed an order from their website. 

Ten minutes later, I got a phone call from a teenaged girl. 

"Um, hi? This is Haystack? And you placed an order? For a pizza? We don't deliver there." 

"Ok," I said hesitantly. "It says on your website that you do. To zip code 94107." 

"Yeah. We don't deliver there." 

"Well," I replied, "it's the first zip code listed on your website. Where it lists the zip codes you deliver to. What do you suggest I do, here?" 

"Um? My manager's standing right here? And she says we don't deliver there?"

"Well, I can't really argue with that, now." I replied, annoyed and condescending. "You might want to tell your webmaster to update the site with that info." 

"I might want to tell my what??"

Nevermind, and I hung up. One star for not delivering where you say you do, and for being incompetent and unbudging about it. Mediocre pizza not worth the hassle. Thanks to Yelp I discovered Mozzerella di Bufala instead.
author: Trisha W.

description:
I always get delivery, they say 45 minutes, it usually arrives in 30.  You can order online or by phone.  I've got them programmed on my cell.

I've recently discovered the joys of thin crust pizza.   Less likely to get stuffed without that thick crust and I can enjoy, the cheesy goodness.  However, sometimes i wished they used more mushrooms.  Also, they are pretty good about crediting you if there is a problem with your order.

The only thing that concerns me, is they hang on to your credit card info in their database.  So even when you pay cash and get your receipt from the driver, you entire credit card number is printed out in all it's glory.  Can someone fix this?  Or truncate the number so the whole thing is not displayed?
author: Jenn A.

description:
Ordered a pizza (olives, mushrooms, onions with a whole wheat crust) from here the other evening.  

The good -- it tasted alright but...

The bad -- the pizza was cold and was stuck to the paper under it (you know the sheet of paper put between the pizza and the pizza box...  is that usually there?).

So, after you reheated the pizza, peeled it off the paper sheet, it was OK.  That is, if you don't mind your pizza being all messy (after having to pick it off the paper sheet).  I'd rather have had frozen pizza -- it's cheaper and tastes at least as good (especially since I had to heat it up anyway). 

With so much good pizza in SF, we won't be ordering from here again.
author: S J.

description:
Man oh man. 
I used to love haystack. Went there this week with my boyfriend, and no doubt they took care of us, the waiters gave us the booth when there were only two of us at the beginning of the dinner rush. And they were polite as usual. Now for the disappointing part. :( 
 The calamari wasn't thouroughly cooked, edible but kinda gross. However, they took it back- when it came out the second time it was properly cooked(bland but whatever)
*the pizza tasted good. We ordered pepperoni and garlic. They went kinda crazy with the garlic, but it was good. I love garlic, so it wasn't a HUGE problem.
*the beer was poured improperly. I saw the chick do a hillarious attempt at pouring us a pitcher-complete with a classy "sccop the foam out with a spoon technique" never seen that befor but I got a good chuckle. 


THE NEXT DAY: we both had the most terrible diarrehea!!! Eeeewwww muddbutt!! We didn't know if it was something else we ate until we decided to test our luck an have leftovers last night. It was definetly the pizza. WE HAVE FULL BLOWN FOOD POISINING!!!! 
He's throwing up as we speak we've  been losing it from both ends. 
Never again will I return. So sad. I used to love this place
author: anna b.

description:
Anyplace needs to deliver until 4 or they suck



edit - 8/4/07
So what happens when you've had about 10 drinks in 8 hours on a Friday?  You want FOOD, NOW!  Which means the original review above MAY have been not only made while drunk, but also hungry.  Not a good way for Laura to be.  FWIW, I have had their pizza and it isn't very good at all, so I don't feel too guilty about the one star.
AND - Can we PLEASE get a GOOD late night restaurant in the NOE/CASTRO area?  I'm talkin' 24 hours AT LEAST on the weekends.  Yes, I am SHOUTING for it!
author: laura g.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here on a lazy Friday night after walking the city and craving Pizza. Being close to my house in Noe Valley was the determining factor on why we chose this place over the many options in the city.

When we first arrive, we had the unfortunate experience of being seated in a booth next to a large table of kids who looked like they were part of a little league. Boo. Loud and obnoxious kids are not fun at dinner time.  So after kindly asking our waitress for a new table, we were escorted to the cozy back room of the restaurant... a much better environment!

We ordered a picther of beer... which was a good value at $12, and some mozzarella sticks to start, for $6.75 (I think). While the sticks were the generic run of the mill frozen kind... I was surprised at how large the order was... 10 sticks total! Also a good value!

We ended up ordering the "Old MacDonald" pizza... with chicken, onions, garlic, and tomatoes. The pizza was actually really good with one exception... the tomatoes were large slices... and I would have preferred them to be diced into smaller pieces.

All in all... our bill was about $40, plus tip. While on the surface I thought this was pricey for pizza for two... we did get a pitcher of beer which yielded us 3 beers each, mozzarella sticks, and a medium pizza which was large enough that we ended up taking half of it home to enjoy the next evening after we got home from the bar. :-)

Now that I have found this place... I will probably be back for more of their pizza...
author: Matt O.

description:
Their New York style thin crust pizza and antipasta are good.  Take out / Delivery always tastes like shit.  Make sure you dine in.
Tacky decor, but fits the place well
author: Pug P.

description:
I'm not sure whether it's the uninspired sauce, with doughy pizza crust or the insipid table guests we had.  But I really hate this place.  Yes we have a toddler and yes we should like the other parents--- but nothing, nothing could prepare me for the god-awful food that this place serves.  There isn't  enough wine in Italy to make go back there again.  Then there's the lack of courtesy from the other parents, who have forgotten that their screaming two-year old isn't cute to anyone else but his deaf parents.  

Can say it again, I HATE this place.
author: Princess P.

description:
I haven't tried the Pizza, but one day, I walked in, and and ordered ravioli with pesto dressing (meat filled) + galic bread.
That was a REALLY GOOD LUNCH. That was the BEST garlic bread I've had in a while, I dunked it in my pesto sauce and it was 
DELICIOUS! =D 

Yes, it was kind of expencive, I think around 15 bucks or maybe less. I know for sure it was over 10. But it is worth it, the serving was really big for me, and I got full almost halfway and saved the other half for dinner. 

The blond lady who always works there is courteous and talks with a smile. I really like this place =)
author: Sophia G.

description:
I wish I could give this place ZERO stars.  Now, to be TOTALLY FAIR, I did not have the OPPORTUNITY to ACTUALLY eat here.  Here is what happened.  It was a couple nights after Christmas, a couple nights BEFORE New Years.  Me and my crew were looking for some pizza in Noe Valley.  Haystack looked festive from outside.  So we went inside.

Once in, we were asked to wait by the bar, while a table was prepared.  Now, the restaurant was nearly empty, so we were not really sure what we were waiting for.  Um, OK.  So we waited by said bar....and waited....

Finally, we were escorted to a booth.  We then waited for menus.  And waited....and waited.

After ANOTHER 10 minutes, yes 10 MINUTES, we were GRANTED the PLEASURE of menus.  NO ONE came and talked to us in that 10 minutes, no one acknowledged us, not even a nod.  It was almost bizarre.  At this point, we were almost fascinated by the sociological experiment of it all-  how long WOULD it take the folks at the 'Stack to talk to us?

Water was now brought-  But OOOHHH, NOOOO, NO EYE CONTACT, NO NOD, and FOR SURE, NO TAKING OF ANY ORDER.

The bizarreness was finally too much for my roommate, who insisted that we leave.  As we walked out, finally one of the servers said, "what?  you're leaving?"  Um........
author: Jennifer O.

description: We had a great family meal here. I enjoyed the "old style" vibe and feel of the place. Steady crowd the night we were there, many seemed to be repeat customers. Our pizza was perfect, service was great and even checked to make sure we had all we needed. Made for a fun evening.
author: Dave E.

description:
Since moving out of my place in Noe Valley, the one thing that I have consistently missed more than anything is getting delivery from Haystack. The penne rigate is THE BOMB! It has grilled chicken, vegetables and a delectable lemon-cream sauce. I am addicted to it. It seems like everything else on their menu pales in comparison.

When I would order delivery from my place about six blocks away, it would arrive ridiculously fast. Sometimes it seemed like under 20 minutes. The tins of pasta were always so hot that they almost burned my hands. The delivery minimum is only $10 which is fantastic. Their portions are generous and a couple can share a single entree. A yummy meal for two, delivered in minutes, for about $15. Unbeatable. I love you Haystack!

fyi, you can order delivery directly from their website
author: Aaron V.

description: All the 1 star reviews don't make any sense that they might have been paid off to talk mess. Anyway me and friends drive 20 minutes to get to this awsome mecca of pizza's. As for delivery issues nobody is perfect, I've waited over 2 hours for pizza to be delivered from 10 min away pizzaria. Stop being hates the pizza is good and service is awesome.
author: Maher A.

description:
Dining In: I was with a group of 4 or 5 people pretty late on a week night and every place we had tried was closed. We stumbled upon Haystack as they were about to shut their doors for the night, but they agreed to seat us. The service was good given the late hour (the wait staff was obviously trying to get out of there). The pizza was great, we had the New Yorker and Old MacDonald. The decor was random in a good sort of way. It felt very homey. 

Delivery: We tried them for delivery one weekend, and used the online ordering feature (pretty cool). We immediately got a call to confirm (very prompt). It took about 40-45 minutes, as they said, however they mixed up our order and give us regular crust instead of thin crust. An honest mistake, which happens. Flavors were still good. I would order delivery again but be extremely specific while filling out the online information.
author: kathy c.

description:
I thought that I yelped this already.  What a loser I am.

Haystack is the best pizza on the block up here.  The toppings are quality and plentiful.  You can order on-line and it magically shows up about 45 minutes later.  I really like it.

It is true that there are no major inovations in pizza at haystack. For me that is ok.  Sometimes you just want to have some good-old-fashioned pizzeria pizza.
author: Thadd L.

description:
The delivery was FAST (30 minutes or less) and the pizza is so-so.  

I would have given this place an extra star or two, but today I pulled my leftover cheese pizza out of the fridge and began to eat it when I found NOT ONE but TWO black, pubic-like hairs baked into the cheese.  (i.e. it absolutely must have come from the kitchen of Haystack because it was COOKED IN.)  I nearly vomited, but at least I didn't find the hairs by pulling them out of my teeth later.
author: Sleuthy W.

description:
"Excuse me, can I get a refill on root beer?"
"Sure, but it's going to cost $1.75"
"But I just paid $2.25 for this tiny ass glass, a whole two liter bottle only costs $1.50"
"That's our policy"

If the pizza was even good, I could have overlooked the soda conversation.  If the service wasn't mildly retarded I could have overlooked the soda conversation.  If the homeless guy I gave our leftovers to didn't look disappointed when I told him the pizza came from haystack I could have overlooked the soda conversation. But no.

It is time for haystack to be put down.  It was great before good pizza came to San Francisco. I'm sure in its day, it was the bomb yo... but now Pauline's, Arinelle's, and Little Star all put haystack to shame, and if I wanted delivery, Escape from New York is still my fave.

And to think Haystack, I probably would have given you 4 stars and not hated you so much had you just given me my 3.5 cents worth of syrup and refilled my tiny ass soda glass.
author: Darren R.

description: No wonder why my mom always orders takeout from this pizza joint whenever there's visitors over at the house. The pizza is so damn good. The tomato sauce isn't that overwhelming on the slices too. I like the way how they put a player of ham or peperoni beneath the toppings of the pizza. It made it even tastier. I'm even trying to eat healthier at the moment and I just couldn't resist eating three slices. Haha. And the crust isn't that bad either. Very eatable like regular bread.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The food at this restaurant is absolute best!
The service was prompt, less than 10 minutes for appetizers and the same for the entree. I recommend the calzone as an entree and the cheesy garlic bread for the appetizer, they are both great.They have a great wine selection. 
They're even open late!! Highly recommended. ...
author: Rod H.

description:
Love the Pizza at the place.
The crust is very tasty and the servings are heart.
I have to say its the bext San Francisco style pizza in SF.
A couple weeks ago I ordered Chicken Parmigianna and I got 2 huge breasts which turned into a great meal and leftovers for another meal.
Its a 70's flash back San Francisco style and as a local boy who was born in Noe Valley its nice to see something from the past still around.
author: Joe R.

description:
Booo!  This place really let me down.  This was my first and last time ordering from here.

__________________
My timeline with Haystack (should be called HayHACK) Pizza:

Ordered at 7:24: Kid answers, totally rude took my order.  Said it would be an hour and would cost more than $17 for a small pizza.  Um, ok.  

Called at 8:30:  Asked what's up with my pizza, it's more than an hour late.  Woman worker said, "I will be there in 5-10 minutes".  Then the kid who took my order in the first place picked up the phone from another line and kept insisting that I was his Mom and that he needed to talk to me.  The woman said, "It's not your Mom" about ten times before he got it.  I mean that is funny shit, but what kind of operation are these people running?

8:50: Called to see what was up.  It's almost been an hour and a half, will you guys at least give me a discount?  Kid says, let me check with my manager, comes back to offer me $3 off.  Wow.  That is LAME.

8:57: Called to cancel.  I've been waiting more than an hour and a half. 

9:10: Guess who just knocked at my door?  The deliveryman.  Nice work calling the poor guy to tell him that the order was cancelled!  What a surprise!  No thank you, not really interested in a pizza that was probably made an hour ago.
__________

Here's my real problem.  No one said sorry once.  Not even when I cancelled.  Worst customer service I've experienced in a long time.  Totally unprofessional.  If I could give it -5 stars I would.  

Also, I took a look at their restaurant and it's supposed to be some kind of a family run place.  Doesn't that mean it should be friendly?
author: Sheila B.

description:
I'm hesitant to give five stars, but I really think this place deserves it. Their pizza is very good, thin crust is excellent although sometimes rolled a little too thin. If you request garlic on your pizza don't make plans to see any vampires later in the evening, because sometimes the pizza maker is a little heavy handed... the pizza cutter (could be the same person I suppose) sometimes cuts the pizza awkwardly with big and very little slices in your pie. But the pasta is great. The environment in here is a little, old west meets Italian coutry-side with just a touch of dive bar thrown in - but you're there for the food not the scenery so, who cares! 

P.S. good delivery service too!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
3 stars? WHAAAAT?!
Me,my boyfriend, and friend went here at about 1:30 am when there was nothing open in site after a few drinks at Bliss Bar. holy crap. was I happy that this place was open..the atmosphere is what an authentic Italian place should be. very homie. Not to mention the pizza was GREAT. I usually would frown at the choice of vegetarian pizza but it didn't matter this time. So gooooood. It tasted like true Italian pizza. When I'm back in SF I will for sure go back there.
author: Natasha F.

description:
It's just fine. As in "oh, yes, everything's fine" but -not- as in "say, this is some FINE pizza."

The crust is a little too thick and chewy for my taste, and the ingredients could be of a higher quality, but their pies are decently made and much better than those from other places that deliver to my 'hood.
author: anita c.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Haystack's pizza, calzones, wine list or their choice in kitchy 60's/western decor but their pasta is INCREDIBLY good and you can get good beers in pitchers. Although there's a Pasta Pomodoro in Noe Valley that has better ambiance, I prefer Haytstack's pasta and Haystack is cheaper so I hardly ever went there. My favorite things are the penne rigate - rich, creamy, lemony sauce, tender chicken, lots of zucchini and broccoli - and the... carbonara something... I seriously order the Penne Rigate at least once a week and never get tired of it. It's always delicious and so good I don't see why I wouldn't continue to keep having it regularly.

The best thing about Haystack is that you can order delivery from their website. Perhaps it's because we lived so close, but it always came so quickly that the aluminum tray was so hot you couldn't touch it with your bare hands, even inside it's paper bag. The garlic cheese bread fried zucchini and mozzarella sticks are also excellent.
author: Kristina A.

description:
You can't get better pizza in San Francisco than what you can get at Haystack (and I used to live in Chicago, so I know a thing or two about pizza).  Oodles of toppings, crazy rural 1970s pizzeria decor (paneling, baby, yeah!), ambivalent staff, good beer selection, and somebody-stop-me-holy-cow-it's-so-silly-good pizza.  

Good place to order in from (and a very easy online ordering system - you can think about what you'll order later while you're eating lunch at your desk at work and then say - online - I want this delivered at 7:00, and they actually show up ON TIME), but it's an even better place to visit.

The Greek salad is a big winner, the meat ravioli pretty standard, but you're not going here for salad or ravioli.  It's the pizza, kids.  Trust me.

AND:  Last time I was there, I lost my wallet right outside the front door, but didn't notice until later.  The person who found it brought it to my house.  THOSE are the kinds of people who eat at Haystack.  What's not to love?
author: Evan G.

description:
I have always regarded Haystack as a kid friendly place. The quality of the pizza can be so-so, but my daughter likes it so we enjoyed going there. 

But recently we experienced something that really changed our minds about the place. It was Saturday and we got their pretty early 5:30 ish (family time). When we walked in their was a free table up front so we asked the waiter if we could sit there. He said yes, but then saw that we had a child with us and mumbled something about saving the table for a larger party and wanted us to sit in thback. We reluctantly agreed, as my experience with the back room is that it is hot, stuffy and you get ignored by the wait staff.. 
e 
All of which proved to be the case that night, in addition to which it was full of families with kids (the kiddie corral) 

The wait staff was barely polite and the pizza was like bland cardboard. 

As we left (swearing to not come again) I noticed that at the table in the front there was just a couple, not the "big party" the waiter lied about. It was obvious that families with kids are not welcome to sit in the front par rt of a restaurant that proclaims itself to be a "Family Restaurant".  So as far as "kid-friendly" goes, I would change that to be a big fat "NO".
author: Erin C.

description: Haystack Pizza - New Yorker with black olives and sausage. It is my second favorite pizza ever. Always count on it to be greasy, garlicky goodness.
author: Erin A.

description: Have been eating here occasionally for over 30 years. The quality of the entrees and service have definitely gone downhill -- while the prices have risen disproportionately.  I still like the pizza with that thick, doughy, yeasty crust and the generous iceburg lettuce and canned beans salad with fresh, chunky (made in-house?) blue cheese dressing. This is 1970's comfort food at 2011 prices. They used to serve hearty, acceptably-priced lamb chops, chicken parmigiana, and spaghetti with meatballs, always enough for leftovers, but no more. It's been nearly empty for the last few years whenever I've been in. Haystack's Hayday is ovah. The last waiter we had is an incredibly cute, sensitive, boyish body builder -- and is the only reason why I'd return.
author: Lotion M.

description: I've ordered take-out from Haystack for the almost 20 years I've lived in Noe Valley.  I love their pizzas - the Haystack Special, the Zorba; also a combo of pepperoni, linguica, mushroom and onion that they make for me which is delicious.  My friends have all loved it also when we've had it together.  It's a family owned restaurant with a nice neighborhood charm - the owner and the servers are mostly family members and their friends.  It seems like some folks that have eaten there haven't gotten great service, but I can say that the pizza have ordered for many years has almost always been tasty and worth it (and I've tried many kinds of pizza.)  For me it's been a five-star staple over the two decades I've lived here.
author: Brian C.

description:
I can say with great certainty that this pizza is edible. I managed to eat two of eight slices. From what I can tell however, this place dislikes, or refuses to believe in the existence of tomato sauce.

Good news: they do believe in cheese! In fact, they perhaps believe in it too strongly. The pizza showed up with what was probably once a veritable sea of cheese that had somehow gone solid, trapping sad, doomed slices of white onion.

All of this might have to do with the fact that it took just over an hour for our pizza to show up to our door. Perhaps this sad pie sat in a driver's car, unloved and forgotten until someone realized that it was closed to closing time and, oh, what is that in the back seat?

I'd like to like this place, because, well, I _want_ to like places. I'll probably give them another shot some time soon and see if things improve.
author: Holly T.

description: Solid Pizza. The thing that sticks out to me was the portion. a Wagon Wheel, XL was in fact enormous and relatively cheap. Sauce was lacking, but the crust Awesome) and freshness of other ingredients carried the Pie. With a big group, i'll be back
author: Stephen C.

description:
This is restaurant is alright for dining in.  The Western decor is kinda cool, if you're into that.  I think the pizza here is fantastic...nice thick crust, tons of cheese (probably just a little too much), and they definitely don't cheap you on the toppings.  Unbeknowest to many, this place also serves really good hamburgers.

I must admit I've had mixed service here.  Also, DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES ORDER FOR DELIVERY, especially if you are starving.  They will lie to you, deceive you, tell you the food's on its way, tell you driver is new, tell you the driver just left with your order, and hours later it will finally arrive, your pizza piping hot, fresh out of the oven.  WTF?
author: Kerry D.

description:
This is good pizza, but this is NOT New York style pizza.  The crust is thick and has a good texture and the sauce is tangy and a little sweet.  Are there better pizza places in the city?  Probably?  Will any of those pizza places deliver to Diamond Heights?  Nope.  

When it comes to delivery, I have to admit, they are a little slow.  This is a mom and pop shop, so when I order from them, I usually expect them to be at my door in about an hour.  

The appetizers are really tasty too, though it seems like they might be frozen and then just thrown in the fryer.  Honestly though I don't go there for the appetizers or the salads.  I'm there for the pizza and they do that well.  

I have to say that Haystack pizza is actually better one day later after spending the night in the fridge.  All the flavors seem to tighten up a little more.  

This is a great place for a date or a chill night on the town.  

Sure Little Star is close by, but you have to wait and find parking in the Mission or on Divisadero.
author: Adam E.

description:
This is my favorite Pizza place in San Francisco. I've been eating Haystack pizza for a very, very long time. Actually, I think Haystack may be the first Pizza I have ever eaten. I love it! But enough about me, getting back to the review. It's a great neighborhood restaurant, the staff is super friendly and they do make some yummy pizza. I would have given it 5 stars, but they do have the occasional pizza mess-up. (ie. too greasy, soggy, too much crust). However, they do manage to get the pizza just right most of the time. In addition to their pizza, the 2nd best thing on the menu is their "Spicy Buffalo Wings." They pack as much flavor as saucy buffalo wings, but Haystack's wings are nice and crunchy! Yum!! Haystack is definitely worth a try! 

Recommendations: 
The Alexander (Specialty Pizza #1)
Leilani - The Hawaiian (Specialty Pizza #5)
Luigi - The Italian (Specialty Pizza #6)
Spicy Buffalo Wings
author: Lisa T.

description:
I am constantly in search of good pizza here in the Bay Area. Haystack was a big let down. The crust is insanely doughy, super bready and is slightly sweet. It's just not good. 

The entrees are ok and they do give you a lot.  I would definitely not go out of your way to try Haystack, but it's not terrible if you go the entree route.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I always thought that Haystack Pizza was the best place to order a pizza on this side of town until the other night. We ordered a pizza  and to my amazement, it looked no different from your local Pizza Hut or Domino's pizza. The toppings we ordered were sausage, extra cheese and tomatoes. Well, they are definitely beginning to skimp on their toppings. Some pieces of pizza had only one morsel of sausage and most no more than two and the extra cheese, let's just say "extra" is not what you get.

 In the past we didn't mind paying $30 dollars for an extra large pizza when we had company over because we knew that we were getting exactly what we paid for and also bragging rights for our local pizzeria. Next time we have company over, I will think twice before I pay another $30 for a pizza from Haystack.
author: J D.

description:
We just moved to Noe and finding a restaurant that has good selection on the menu, delivers quickly and is close by, is difficult.  Haystack wins on all fronts.  The pizza is great and the fact that they use real bacon as a topping option is unique and will keep me coming back. They make thin and thick crusts, however, the thin crust pizza can get soggy quickly with the toppings.  The thick/regular crust pizzas can be a bit dry so I would suggest asking for extra sauce if you go that route.

They have a full, and diverse menu so if you're not in the mood for Italian, there are many other choices.  There are the must try 'hot wings', that are slightly spicy, crispy and seasoned just right.  They even serve burgers and fries which are tasty.  We ordered their spinach salad and Greek salad and that was good as well - very fresh.

The service is good and they stay open later than most of the spots on 24th in Noe.
author: Renee J.

description:
This place is all-around average. I'd go there if I didn't feel like going out of my way to go somewhere better--which is what happened when I ordered online for lunch.

Props for being technically savvy enough to have online ordering (though shouldn't all restaurants have this by now) but they never called back to confirm the order. After calling, I was informed the order would take 40 minutes to arrive. 40 minutes for a hamburger? okay, whatever. I waited an hour and called again. "It's about to go out for delivery." 30 minutes later I called again, "It's on its way." 15 minutes later, it finally arrived. Not piping hot, but edible. Fries, however were warm and soggy. 

In short, I shouldn't have been so lazy and chosen a better and closer place nearby rather than rely on delivery by Haystack. Despite their lack of delivery service, .there's nothing terrible about this place, but nothing to write home about either.
author: Sabine S.

description:
Haystacks was the first place I had a beer and never carded!

I like Haystacks since I live near there. Their pizza is average, but if you order your crust thin, it's basically just toppings. 

If you want a burger or a meatball sub, they've got those too.

If you're not looking for anything super spectacular, decent pizza, and quick delivery, then go with Haystacks. 

If you're looking for fancy pizza, might I suggest Little Star?
author: David S.

description: I have loved Haystack for years because they make pizza the way I like it:) They know what extra thick crust means, and their sauce is sweet and delicious, not bitter and overwhelming like other pizza restaurants. The ingredients are always fresh and plentiful, plus you can add extra for just a little more. There was a delay with delivery, but after having a nice conversation with the manager they are back on track and better than ever. Thank you Haystack for listening and then delivering your best!! I will continue to recommend you to folks in my neighborhood and yours:) BTW, your Canadian bacon and pineapple with feta and extra thick crust was amazing!
author: John G.

description: I finally decided to give this a place a try after going by it several times. I have to say the Thick Crust PIzza is really good, and reasonably priced. It is now on my favorite places to get Pizza in SF. The service needs a little help, and that is the reason I am not giving it 5 stars. I think they need more help, staff appeared to be stretched thin, which then increased the wait. The wait for the Pizza was worth it!
author: Justin B.

description:
My review is from my experience as a delivery customer - I have never eaten in the restaurant.

I'm a positive person so I would like to start by saying that Haystack is convenient if you like to order your pizza online - it works... however, that's where the positive ends.

I only have two words for their pizza - soggy and tepid...okay a couple more... just don't do it and haunts you for days.
author: ohreleigh ..

description:
I had the Caesar Salad and a Calzone and was truly amazed at the terrible quality of every single ingredient. Cheap lettuce, bad cruttons and absolutely insufferable amount of rubbery, partially melted cheese in the calzone. There was a pink tint to the outside of the dairy mass, which is all there was in the way of sauce. I asked for some extra on the side to try and put together a few palatable bites; that showed up on the bill. 

I could see reading this review and thinking that I've been overly hash and snobby, but I can tell you that this was literally the worst meal that my dining companion or I can remember. A tremendous disappointment.
author: Danielle R.

description: Worst counter service ever.  It's a shame. My family used to order take out from here almost weekly, but today's extremely rude service has put a stop to that.  First of all, the stupid counter girl overcharged me.  After I pointed out the correct price and handed her a copy of their own menu with the price right in front of her face, her only response was that she had to charge whatever showed up on the computer.  I mean really, use your brain.  Is it really worth losing a regular customer? When I tried later to speak with a manager on the phone, she obviously realized it was me calling in to complain about her, and I never received a call back.  Not the way to treat patrons.  Will never return.
author: Irene F.

description: My girlfriend lives across the street form Haystack and I have eaten there many times. If you love thin-crust pizza Haystack is a decent choice. The staff are super nice and the place does have a very friendly atmosphere, but the pizza is extremely greasy and softens the perfectly cooked crust. There pasta dishes and salads are delicious! I often order the antipasto salad and it is LOADED with meat and veggies! Overall a decent place to have a pie or some pasta.
author: Norm N.

description:
Haystack is definitely the place to beat around the Noe-Castro area. I've never had a problem with them over many orders. Pizzas arrive hot, quick, and delicious. You can even order your pie online--which saves so much embarrasment when you're stammering to order over the phone while obviously inebriated. (Or so I'm told.)

Not a huge fan of dining in there. Friendly service, but sometimes on the slow side. Why go out when you can dine in tho?
author: Aaron L.

description:
I went into this place for lunch today, as I always pass by it while walking down 24th street.  1 o clock on a Wednesday afternoon, and the only other patrons beside myself were a group of rowdy highschoolers and a middle-aged woman.  Needless to say, the service was good enough-- my waitress was friendly and even brought over some french bread for my baby, Magnus, to gnaw on in his stroller, and the food was delivered hot and timely... but great service cannot make up for dismal food.

My calamari was bland and came with an odd red sauce I think was supposed to be marinara, but tasted like catsup.  The spaghetti was the most disappointing, as I was hoping for a truly flavorful sauce and received a watery, bland and boring mess that i covered in cheese to make barely edible...  Long story short, I ate maybe 1/3 of the food but wasn't interested in finishing... or in taking it home.

There are several other pizza/Italian places in Noe Valley, so I don't think I'll come back here again.
author: Julia R.

description:
Extra-large beef and onion.

They are going to cater my birthday.
author: J-Meoww W.

description:
Not the worst pizza I can imagine, but I was expecting a lot more from Haystack pizza. It seemed like one of those neighborhood staples that would be a classic. Not the case.

When I lived at Mission and 24th, many moons ago, I used to frequent Noe Valley for brunch mostly. Here, I noticed Haystack and thought: "wow, this place really keeps it real." They seemed old school and classic. The pizza however has much to be desired.

It seemed that they cooked it properly. The cheese to sauce to crust ratio was adequate. The main problem was a horrible crust. Horribly unseasoned. I can't say much for the sauce, but the crust was the major downfall of the pie. Especially when making thick crust, you must season the crust properly. It's the most important thing. If you had no crust, you would have nothing.

That egregious error exemplifies each ensuing effacement of enthusiastic elations.
author: Berg W.

description: Friday night pizza dinner with friends. Waitress was very pleasant as was a young man who gave us refills on our soda.  Our veggie pizza was just ok.  The crust was good and the toppings were plentiful.  The garlic tasted a bit on the bitter side. Please put more pizza sauce on your pizzas.  You could hardly see it on the pizza and it affected the over all taste of the pizza because as you bite into the slice you want to taste the crust, sauce, cheese, then toppings in that order in order to get the full pizza experience.  That is why I rated it like I did.
author: M R.

description:
The appetizers were crummy, the wine was acceptable, and the spaghetti and meatballs were the worst I've ever eaten. Seriously, it was like they fashioned the meatballs from a pile of old cats they had lying out the back, then served them up on a bed of tomatoed shoelaces.

The serving staff were very nice, though. Perhaps we should order pizza next time.
author: Glen M.

description:
sad excuse for pizza. Yuck!
I ordered their signature pizza the Haystack online---and..i seriously don't know where to start with the failure that is Haystack Pizza. 

First off ----Thick flabby dough, no sauce, rubberized cheese, wet mushrooms, par-cooked onions, SOGGY pepperoni and salami, wayyyy too many green peppers, but the sausage was ok. If they're gonna make a thick pizza-- they need to make it right-- the end product was way too soggy. We tossed it into the compost bin.

Second-- delivery time. it took an hour and 40 minutes to receive the pizza. that was way too long. I used to waiting around an hour for delivery food, but this time frame isn't acceptable. 

Third-- Delivery guy-- Guy forgot to include the homemade garlic bread . He did offer to comeback again with it, but after 100 minutes waiting for the stupid pizza I said No-please refund my credit card. Did they? no. When I called to confirm the refund-- they had no clue. 

Finally-- it's not a value meal. $22 for a large with a 1 inch crust, no sauce and loaded with inexpensive ingredients to add volume is a ripoff. Don't count on leftovers -- unless you like pizza soup.

Conclusion: This place totally sucks. Places like this ruin the "pizza is like sex" motto, cause this pizza blows but not in the good way.
author: Pea H.

description:
I can't believe this place is in Noe Valley, seriously, a blast from the past.  Old school vibe, young white clean cut servers, a bit dusty, and rustic feeling.  
Tasty pizza and salad!  
Very relaxing, good for families.
author: jennifer t.

description:
Me and Hubby were at Twin peaks..We were looking for any pizza place around.we ended up here..Dine-In
*Warm atmosphere
*Yummy cheese,sauce,perfect crust 
*good price ................a small looked like a *Medium /large.
*Even the water was good.
*Good service
Although we were the only ones eating there on a late tuesday night
it took a while for the pizza to be ready..we were satisfies.It was Delicious.I would drive back from SJ to eat here again!.
author: Jehzabella V.

description: While I prefer their pizza to the others in the neighborhood, their entrees are just ok.  Service can be iffy and they are always busy.  Basically the place is a dump, but it's a neighborhood pizza place not a destination...
author: Karen C.

description:
Tried Haystack again, and for the last time.  Why would you even waste your time and money getting food from this place, when there are 20 other local Italian restaurants and pizza joints that serve better food with better service for the same price?

As another reviewer said, Haystack's food pales in comparison to what you can get at a mall's food court.  Never again will I make the mistake of eating at Haystack.
author: Josh M.

description: Online ordering rocks. Lightning fast delivery. Always perfect pizza.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I ordered a greek pizza for delivery. The crust was okay. The toppings were generous and delicious. The delivery was a bit over the stated time, but whatever, good pizza takes time.

I'm not a pizza fanatic. In fact, I'm pretty meh about pizza in general. So if I like a pizza, it's probably pretty good.
author: Matt W.

description:
It was an intense night with my friends celebrating election night and the city was stirring with excitement. But not Noe Valley. Nothing was opened, we were starving, and we stumbled into Haystack.
