I tend to judge pizza restaurants on the chicken wings they have. lets just say that they looked like they came from "costco" as one of my buddies put it. the ingredients seemed very fresh on the Haystack Pizza but wasn't totally impressed with the burnt crust. Good thing for the ranch dressing coming to the rescue.
author: Gabe H.

description:
I've ordered from Haystack dozens and dozens of times over maybe 15 years. Here's my favorite: pizza with pesto sauce, canadian bacon and feta cheese. It melts in your mouth. Thick soft delicious crust, lightly oily pesto sauce, lightly crispy canadian bacon. And feta cheese to make it over-the-top creamy and rich. I don't even want to know how many calories/carbs each slice has, but because the guilt of the experience overwhelms me, I always order their spinach salad too. HUGE. Lots of baby spinach, red onion slices, tomatoes, with a bit of bacon and hard-boiled egg slices. They put the dressing on the side, so nothing is soggy. The pizza/salad combo is enough to last for a few days. Perfect. 

I've also ordered burgers/fries from them several times, and the reason that it works so well is that they put all of the condiments on the side. You get a burger/bun, and then you have a separate side bag jammed full of lettuce, onions and tomato. And then your usual squeezie-thingies of mustard/ketchup. The burgers stay relatively warm during delivery -- although I've always lived pretty close, so the travel distance wasn't far. Their french fries are SO GOOD. Huge super-thick-cut home made fries. Lightly golden.

Once I ordered an actual Italian meal from them -- ravioli, and it was also a delicious meal. They have a good selection of non-pizza items.

I know you can order online, but I've never tried that. And for all of the times I've ordered for delivery, I've only eaten inside their restaurant a couple of times. The decor (wagon wheel chic) just doesn't do it for me. But I've gone in for pick-up, and have never seen a crowd of any sort. It seems like the kind of place that you could go and get a seat at a huge booth at just about any time of the day/nite.

After so many years of providing me with such satisfying food, I'm happy to be able to do a little something for them by singing their praises here.
author: Zoe H.

description:
I went to High School down the street, so I often passed this little place. Its GOOD, but its not AMAZING. 

Good prices, better waiters (I guess you get better service when you aren't in a uniform), and good crust. I'm all about the crust. 

Street parking is a joke. Usually. But when I do come to Noe Valley, I have been very lucky with parking. I highly suggest taking the bus or the J. Or even walking from BART. It's a nice stroll!
author: Coco C.

description:
Ahhh the good old days of pizza.

This is how pizza used to be. My friend and I ordered "The Haystack." The pizza toppings were sausage, salami, pepperoni, mushroom, bell pepper & onions.

It's so refreshing to eat a good pizza unlike all those typical chain pizzas.

The atmosphere is like an old western hometown restaurant . It feels like home.
author: Bert T.

description:
really nice people.

no parking in the evening...sometimes no parking during the day.

its okay pizza and pasta.  they have a huge menu so i guess that goes to why everything is okay.

if they had less of a choice they'd be MUCH BETTER but they make so much that it takes away from how good other things can be.

i've had pizza and pasta and the minestrone soup.  it was AGAIN...okay.
author: Bing D.

description: Food was mediocre. Service was not very good. And the seating was so incredibly cramped I had to sit with my feet diagonal to not bump knees with my dining partner.
author: Nicolai T.

description:
Food is decent, if greasy.  The delivery leaves a lot to be desired, unfortunately.  The last time we ordered, it took an hour (which they told us about in advance).  The driver forgot one part of our order, so he want back to get it.  Came back lukewarm.  

The least you can do when you're that late is give the item for free, or to give us a break on the next order.  As it is, we're never ordering from them again.
author: Bill J.

description: The Pizza here is good.  For the Noe Valley area it seems like a really boring restaurant.  They do serve Italian food which doesn't seem to be what they really want to sell.  The service seems to be fair but nothing to write home about.  For the location I expect more.  Which I was sad to say did not happen.
author: Ramona L.

description:
The pizza is really lacking. I have not been to the restaurant. I ordered a pepperoni and then a combo large pizza for a party. So disappointed and embarrassed. I try to patronize local restaurants where I live in Noe.
 The dough was bland and so was the sauce. The middle was really moist and just fell apart. If you live in Noe go to Escape from New York in the Castro instead or Paxti's (greasy). LIke I said never ordered anything except the pizza which was not good so I am skeptical to try anything else. Also kind of expensive.
author: julie q.

description: This place is not very good even for a down home pizza and Italian food joint.  Salads were crappy ice berg lettuce and very little else.  The meatball sub was on a pretty old tasting roll, and the meatballs were nothing to write home about.
author: Todd R.

description: YUMMY pizza & decent salads too! This place has lots of character & really good service! Went for a friend's b-day dinner so we had a few tables in the back. They even let us bring in balloons & cupcakes :) The pizza crust on our veggie pizza was my fave--perfectly thick & doughy. The pizza also had a great garlic flavor :) Will definitely be back. I've heard people swear by there Veal Parmigiana.
author: Mel A.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE.  

I just tried to order a pizza for take out, was hung up on twice, put on hold for over six minutes, and when someone finally answered the phone, I told her I was hung up on twice.  She says, "Ok, so do do you want pick up or delivery?"  So I asked if she was even going to apologize for hanging up on me.  She says- and I quote: "Look, we're busy.  Do you want to order something or not?"  

Needless to say, I did not at that point.  

I have tried their pasta which is beyond gross- overly greasy, not flavorful, and way over priced.  So I wanted to get a pizza, which was clearly not going to happen.

I give this place ZERO stars for some of the worst attitude I've encountered at a restaurant.
author: Ellen S.

description:
the pizza here is alright. My mom loves it. they have good prices. i think it tastes better to-go or for delivery.

they have the best delivery service ever. I live pretty far away and they still deliver. EVEN BETTER..... they deliver anything on their menu. (including steak)
author: angela s.

description: Went the other night.  Had a great pizza.  The service was just ok.  However, to be fair, they were close to being closed and Im sure they wanted to get out of there and go home.  Would go back for sure.
author: Jeremy G.

description: The BEST pizza in SF!!! The crust is like a fresh baguette; they don't skimp on toppings; and they are reasonably priced.
author: Sandra M.

description: I was going to give it a 3, but 2 is appropriate as I have TRULY experienced much better.  It is not bad, but there is nothing mind blowing about their pizza at all.  A girlfriend told me that it wasn't that good and advised not to waste my time, but I had to try it for myself.  It could be better if they did something with their crust.  The crust was similar tasting to a store bought pizza you toss in the oven.  Now that we have extablished I wasn't crazy about the food, the service was very good, and I have no complaints there at all.  They had it ready before the guesstimate they told me, they were very kind and corteous, and even those that knew nothing about my order kept checking in with me.  Very sweet.  I am bound and determined to find a food item I like here just so I can go back and say hi!
author: Gina R.

description: The menu looks amazing!  The pizza looks amazing (we got half Old McDonald and half Haystack) BUT it is not as good as it looks.  The pizza was soggy :(  So soggy that the pizza seemed to be breaking through the bottom of the box and it was impossible to pick a piece of pizza up.  It was edible and some pieces were better than others.  The part was the crust!  It was probably the best crust I have ever had on a pizza.  We did not finish the pizza but since it was so soggy it would not have saved well but I cut the crust off of all the pizza and saved that!  Also, the service was not friendly.  We picked up a to-go order and all the workers seemed angry.
author: Chauntay J.

description: I've been going here for years.  Basic pizza, nothing special but decent.  Last night I ordered a half and half pizza expecting to pay the more expensive half for the whole pie.  Their most expensive "everything" haystack wheel wagon is 31.80, but for something different on the other half the charge for the entire full size pizza PLUS the items on the other half.  This explains a $40 large pizza.  Don't get half and half pizzas or you will be grossly overcharged.  I will NEVER go back there based on principle.  The staff attitude was "tough.  Take it or leave it".  I'll leave it thank you very much.
author: Tim C.

description: Best pizza ever in Noe Valley/Bernal Heights area! I always order Zorba the Greek which has feta cheese, pepperoni, sausage & bell peppers. Omg super Yummy!!! And their Spinach salad and garlic cheese bread is excellent too. Best flavored sauce and specialty pizzas and great Italian food as well. Haystack Pizza is a great family restaurant too. Two thumbs up for Haystack Pizza!! :]
author: Claire K.

description:
This place just has all the right elements that make a pizza place great. Nice and comfortable atmosphere. Great variety of food. Cool staff. 
I don't know what it is about their pizza, but it reminds me of the pizza I grew up with down in Los Angeles. I highly recommend ordering any of their wagon wheel 18 inch pizzas. 

And I usually don't order appetizers at most places. But here, I look forward to it each time. I especially love the cheese sticks as well as the very great tasting Chicken Wings. Although they're a little over priced for the wings, they're just so tasty that I can justify the price.

Also, another cool thing is, this place offers other various choices such as sandwiches, pasta and more. Lots of variety. One of my personal favorite places in this city. 

***Note of caution, when taking a slice of pizza off the pan, pick up the slice starting from the middle. Otherwise it can get pretty messy***
author: Shaun M.

description:
It was a dark and  drizzly Saturday night leaving most locals in orders and probably ordering home delivery.  We were able to get seated right away by a friendly face.  A pizza dinner out with the fiance in our new neighborhood - Noe Valley. 

The place had a nice quiet buzz going on with different groups enjoying their meal and conversation.  As was expected, it did take a few for someone to take our drink and appetizer order once we put aside all the menus and looked plaintively towards the general waitress area.  All smiles when she did arrive to take our appetizer and beer order, we were still debating on the pizza toppings.

In general the staff seemed pretty attentive checking on tables, refilling drink orders and getting to go boxes for left overs.

When the Bruchetta arrived the first thing that I noticed was pink tomatoes, then noticed very little seasoning on think slices of very garlicked bread.  The Luigi somethin' or other with sausage added was then ordered.  IMNSHO, the topping on Bruchetta should be a bit more on the red tomatoey side, diced up nice and small, marinating in olive oil with maybe a touch of garlic and salt and pepper and served on thinner, almost toast slices.  Each place has their own style I understand.  Just won't be ordering that again.

A pitcher of Sierra Nevada went down nice and smooth between the two of us and then the pizza arrived.  YUM!!!  It was delivered by the next waitstaff person available, A.O.K. in my book, as that makes sure it arrives fresh and HOT!  The cheese was nice and gooey, the pesto and garlic made my mouth water and the sausage was nice and not too spicy.  The crust was crispy where it should be, on the very bottom and along the sides and just bready enough on the inside.

Oddly enough however, this was when the wait staff disappeared.  No one came back to make sure our pizza was all right, to see if we needed refills on beer or some water or more napkins.  No offer of coffee and dessert until we stopped a passing person to get a box for our left overs and a check.

Since the pizza was good we'll most likely give delivery a try and maybe one of their other dinner offerings another time.  But if someone said choose now, Noe Valley Pizza would come first.

Late nite is only Friday and Saturday until midnight, Sunday thru Thursday is 11 pm.  Wheelchair accessible would be doable but a tight fit.
author: Marti P.

description:
Great Pizza, reasonble prices.
Easy online ordering!
author: Scott R.

description: There was nothing really bad about the food or service, it's just that there are much better places to eat in SF, especially for the money we paid. We will not be going back again.
author: LH N.

description:
I found out that Haystack makes pizza with whole wheat crust so I decided to order it to be delivered... 

1. The pizza arrived late because the delivery person went to the wrong house. 
2. The deliver guy did not believe me when I said that my house existed. (yes, he told me it did not when I'm pretty sure I know where I live) 
3. The pizza was NOT on whole wheat crust. 

My room mate liked it so much we ordered again the next night...hoping we'd luck out with the driver. We received a call to verify the order and then a few minutes later another call to say that the delivery guy said that he does not deliver to this area. *back up and rewind...what?!* So I told her that the delivery guy came by last night. She said she'd speak with the delivery guy and call me back. A few minute later, I get a call back and she said that the delivery guy does not deliver to my area...AGAIN. 

1. The website states that it delivers to my zip code. 
2. The deliver guy is a major tool. 

The only reason why I'm giving this restaurant an extra star is because the pizza was decent...even though it was on the WRONG crust.
author: Valerie C.

description: I LOVE Haystack!  My husband and I moved away from Noe Valley a few months ago and have been going through withdrawal.  They don't deliver to SOMA, so several times we have actually fought traffic on a Friday night to go to Haystack and get our takeout.  I love the Greek Salad, my husband swears by the Calzone B (add mushrooms).  Anytime we have out of town guests we order from here.  I had to knock off one star for long delivery wait times and a for a lackluster in restaurant dining experience.  The atmosphere is nothing special, but the food is amazing.  Highly recommended!
author: Alison J.

description:
On a recent visit to SF, my husband and I decided to explore a part of the city that we had never been to.  Our son lives in SF and is always bringing us to these yuppie, overcrowded, over raved about restaurants.  Many of them have had very tasty food but that trendy scene gets old and expensive.  As we made our way up 24th we saw this little Italian place, Haystack Pizza.  It reminded us of an old school Italian place so we decided to try it.  It was a Monday at 1pm and there were only a few couples in there eating.  We ordered pizza and a salad.  We LOVE the pizza.  The sauce is perfection.  We didn't get the thin crust (didn't even know they had it until I read the reviews); it was on the thicker side but not too thick and baked to perfection.  A size small was big enough for both of us and we even had a piece left over.  Our salads were just okay. I would actually give the pizza 5 stars but because I haven't tried anything else on the menu I hesitate to give the whole place that much love.

Ambiance is old school.  Don't expect to be impressed with the decor.    But if you want a good pie at decent prices...this is the place.
author: Shell M.

description: Love the pizza!! The pies are pretty large and thick. The toppings are plentiful. It's fresh, not greasy. They are consistently good. I've taken lots of out of town guests here. It's a relatively small place. I always try to sit in the front of the restaurant, as the large groups of kids/families are usually seated in the back area where they have more room. Even still, I very much enjoy Haystack!
author: Heidi L.

description:
If I would have read the reviews before I stopped by the other night, I would have never gone there. But the other night after going to a movie I felt like eating pizza. I did not want anything out of the ordinary... just plain old pizza that would satisfy my pizza craving. It was already 10pm om a Saturday and I was trying to think... where can i get pizza. Haystack's! So off we went to Haystack, parked right outside and were greeted and seated immediately. Our server was a very sweet and polite woman who was nothing but smiles. I ordered the #4 Zorba the Greek pizza (which I thought was expensive at about 16-17 bucks for the small) and my friend got the Italian sausage pizza. I had been to this restaurant years ago and did not remember much of it except that I had gone right after the gym and felt guilty for going there. Anyhoo... I digress... so we are sitting there waiting for our food and other folks come in. It is getting pretty busy for being after 10pm. I figured folks would be at the bar and what not. Alas... the food arrives, my pizza looked so good... it did look like a heart attack waiting to happen and there was no way in the world I could ever eat the entire thing. My friend also got her sandwich with some yummy steak cut fries. I dig in and have my first bite... WOW! It was exactly what I wanted... a hearty pizza. It was very good, granted, I only was able to eat 2 slices and left the other (more than half of the pizza) to take home and savor later on. There was constantly someone asking us how things were (an older gentleman who seemed like he may have been the owner) and he even chit chatted with us. 

I don't know if I was just lucky or if it just depends on who you get to help you, if people are going in with snooty attitudes and it shows, everyone was on that special time or what, the planets were just aligned right, but I seriously didn't experience anything negative while here. I mean... if you want some sort of specialty pizza.. then go to the specialty place... if you just want standard, hearty pizza... this is your place. Hey... I like gourmet like pizza myself... but if that is what you looking for... then save yourself a trip and whiny review and go elsewhere. 

As for delivery mishaps... haven't ordered, but if I ever do... I will drop a few lines about it that experience. Based on my experience... I am a fan :)
author: Amelia M.

description: I've been ordering from Haystack for years and unfortunately, their pizza has been on the decline and yesterday may have been the last time... 70 minutes after having Ordered, I called to find out where my pizza was and was told it "had just left and should be delivered any minute". 25 minutes after that STILL NO PIZZA so I called back only to be told that it was "Leaving right now" so an hour and 45 minutes later I finally had what must've been the most mediocre pizza they've ever made. Sorry Haystack, I'm done....
author: M. S.

description:
Came here after a day of hiking.  I would never choose a pizza place left to my own devices (bread + cheese = chub!)  , but was with starving bf and his parents.  Seriously, he was at that low blood sugar place where I was really wishing I had a Cliff bar in my purse to keep him from passing out!   
We were seated, we ordered from our nice waiter (who seemed a little nervous).   My salad and BF's Dad's pizza came out right away.  I wasn't sure if our waiter heard my order for bruschetta, so I asked if he had gotten it.  I thought that bruschetta would arrive the fastest, being an appetizer and all.   It is a good thing I asked because he came back and apologized - our order hadn't gotten through to the kitchen!   BF swooned with hunger and I fed him some salad and he munched on a slab of his dad's pizza.
Quickly after the error was discovered, we received appropriate amounts of apologies and the food came out within minutes.   Problem solved!  

The food was good -  solidly 3 stars and no complaint on the quality or quantity.   There was nothing outstanding and nothing was wrong -  I would have preferred spicier sauces, but BF's parents are not so into the spices (being British and all).  I think this is one of those places, like Rocco's, where the food is predictable and solid, comforting and filling.  
I guess I'd go there again if I'm ever in the mood for pizza or with guests who are overwhelmed with SF foodie food and just want pizza, salad and straightforward Italian food with no scary weird California-ness.
author: Maria C.

description: I grew up on Haystack Pizza. This is one of the greatest family pizzerias around. They've been at the same location for over 35 years and still going strong!
author: Marty F.

description: I would have to say...mmm meh? We ordered delivery on a Friday night and it got to our home in 45 min-which was quite good...but the pizza was nothing really worth raving over. We ordered 3 personal pizzas: cheese (this one was the best as you really can't go wrong), bbq chicken (no thank you and won't order again..peeled chicken and really quite bland) and a chicken and onion (again, actually bland-despite the onion). I would say if you're looking for easy, simple and reasonable price -it was okay...but yah, that's it..just okay. (I ended up adding my own bbq sauce etc)
author: SLH H.

description: I have grown up eating at the Haystack and it never EVER lets you down! The best pizza in Noe and italian food to die for!
author: stephanie p.

description:
absolutely DELISH!!!

pizza, pasta, chicken, EVERYTHING tastes like home ;D
author: Astrid M.

description:
I dined here last week with a girlfriend and the fams.  My kids wanted burgers and I wanted pizza. My vote was Gialini's and the girls wanted Barney's.  Split the difference - Haystack.
I ordered Zorba the Greek and the Eggplant Especiale, both shared with my friend.  The kids shared a cheeseburger and pasta with cheese and butter.
The salad arrived first and I scarfed it down without a care while my fellow diners waited in agony for their own food to arrive.  The garden salad is satisfying, albeit cafeteria-like, with its canned beets and beans, romaine lettuce and tomatoes.  I ordered it with oil and vinegar, since on a previous visit my friend's request for "Italian" resulted in a slathering of creamy goo. 
The pizza was delivered first.  My oldest whined for her burger while the littlest sucked up whatever morsels landed in front of her.  
I'd ordered "Zorba the Greek," and expected a purist combo of feta and bacon.  What was presented was a delectable burden of sausage, salami, pepperoni, onions and peppers - in addition to the feta and bacon which I thought I'd ordered.  
My friend and I whispered our shock, and then decided to speak up. We'd take it, we said.  But this wasn't what we ordered.  Still, we'd happily accept this mess of meat and cheese, onions and peppers. We were starving.  And we quickly served ourselves. 
When the server brought my daughters' burger and noodles, we told him we  were eating someone else's pizza.   But, that we didn't care.  He said that he had brought the right thing.  And said some other garbled things that we didn't understand. "Yeah, right!" We winked between us.  "Sure."  Positive that he was just saying weird stuff to distract us from the botched order.
My girls happily slurped their simple white noodles and the youngest insisted on a serving of eggplant.  Neither was impressed with the burger, which my eldest described as "overburned."
I told my friend that I was gonna check out a menu, to prove that "Zorba the Greek" was supposed to be only feta and bacon.  I told her that I didn't want our server to feel bad, so I snuck outside to see the menu posted out front.
Dude was right.  Of course.  Stupid me - arguing with the server over the menu;  why do I always have to be such a know-it-all?! Zorba the Greek _was_ actually the #3 combo plus bacon and feta - the "garbled" explanation I'd chosen to ignore. 
We thought we'd never eat all the food we'd ordered, but all that remained of our feast was one slice of Zorba the Greek.  Which i re-heated for breakfast the next morning.

Update 05/27 -
Ordered pizza for delivery last night.  Waited an hour, no pizza. Called to get an update - they said they were running late, and also having trouble with my CC.  Gave them my CC again.  Another 1/2 hour - still no pizza.  This time they said the driver had attempted delivery, but nobody was home.  I'd been sitting in the livingroom the whole time, feeding the kids potato chips. 
Finally called Noe Valley Pizza, and they were open and ready for my hungry family.  
This morning - not only had my CC been charged for the meal -  they actually charged me twice for the undelivered pizza!!!!
author: Kati K.

description:
the only thing that makes haystack pizza better is going there on a rainy night with megan w and maria d and sitting in the biggest booth that they have (for a family of 10 but i don't care, the place was empty and i have a big ass so BACK OFF).  you can learn a lot dining with the hot ladiez of yelp.  for example:  urine is very clean and can be used as toner in the shower if you're uh, exceptionally frugal?  because damn, you can get some toner for like $1.99 at walgreens, you cheap bitch!  and b) the hilary duff/heather locklear masterpiece, "the perfect man" was actually written by a 12 year-old.  but if you saw the film (sorry, "film") you already knew that.  i totally just outed myself about seeing that film.  twice.  

you can also learn a lot about football.  seriously, megan w knows more about football than the entire new york yankees, los angeles lakers AND mighty ducks football teams COMBINED, okay???

and you ask me how much do i love haystack pizza?  how much?  the correct answer is THIS!!!!! much.  (that's about as much as someone with asperger's syndrome loves a cassio keyboard, fyi.)

P.S. YOU CAN ORDER ONLINE FOR DELIVERY!  that's right, you can order without even interacting with another human being.  THAT'S service.  i have them deliver to my house as it is two long (read: short) blocks to my house.  and what makes zucchini bearable?  you deep fry that fucker and nobody does it better than haystack.  NOBODY.
author: Laura B.

description:
i'll make this review sweet and simple because the experience i had was also a 'turkey shoot", uncomplicated...

so, the decor of this joint is obsolete, but  they gratify you with their passable pizza which you could also have your pie in wheat dough and that is a perk! 

a warm service was also demonstrated by our waiter which  made my dinner satisfying!

that is all folks!
author: Nelle A.

description: I like the place, as others have written it has a warm feel to it, a good place to have a pie and beers and catch up with friends. The service is decent, nothing great but nothing to complain about either. The pie is good, not out of this world or anything. The large pies are a bit undercooked in the middle, so I would recommend the medium, two of them if you are hungry enough. If your in Noe Valley and craving pizza I would suggest haystack, I wouldn't go out of your way to come here to eat though.
author: Bobby B.

description: This is our favorite Pizza place in SF. The pizza is always delicious and delivery is always prompt. Tasty pizza
author: Sean G.

description: My girlfriend and i were looking for somewhere you could actually sit down and grab some pizza and beers that wasnt a shady lil by the slice joint and after walking around 24th st. we found this place.  The service was a little slow to get acknowledged, but the food was good. I would go back next time i am up that way for sure
author: jamie z.

description: I can remember coming here as a small child, and last week I took my baby there for the first time- and she loved it too.  It's not a super trendy place, so if you're looking for that kind of establishment, it's really not for you, but if you're just looking to go somewhere to go, chill out and have some good pizza, this place is great.  The waiter was super friendly & attentive and one of the other waiters came by just to say hello to the little one.  Our pizza was out quickly, our drinks refilled as soon as they got low, and I believe the manager came over to check in and see how we were doing.  Love this place, love the pizza, will keep coming back.
author: L C.

description: I was in Noe Valley the other night in need of a yummy new place to have dinner and decided on Haystack. My boyfriend and I shared the bruschetta and a GIANT calzone filled to the brim with delicious cheese, meat and artichoke hearts. The service was friendly and prompt and the portions were fantastic. My only complaint was them blaring country music in the back of the restaurant. Not really the kinda ambiance I was hoping for!
author: Britney K.

description: I really like this pizzeria. I like that it feels so inviting, and it's a cool place to bring a group of friends. I've had about 4 kinds of pizza, and they were all delicious! I also like there customer service, they are not snobby! They donated a gift card for a charity I was working for! The only bad thing about this place is that it's a bit pricey, but it's worth it. There sauteed mushrooms are soooo good!
author: Gabriel T.

description: My husband & i were in the neighborhood one night and decided to try this place out - it was horrible, some of the most overpriced and greasy, tasteless pizza ive ever had. The place seemed pretty dirty too - there are SO many good restaurants and so many places where you get get an awesome pizza or at least one that is good - this isn't the place...skip it by all means.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
Decent pizza, but holy smokes, are they expensive.  If they were 33% cheaper, I would give them 3 stars.  If you have bills to drop, then go for it, but for that money you could do much better elsewhere.

I wanted to order a large pizza with 12 wings, and the price came to about $40.  Forty dollars?!?!  I was so shellshocked, I thought "Umm, maybe that's just how much it costs these days" and I just placed the order and hung up.

I turned around and told my friends with whom I was watching football with, and they all yelled at me, called me stupid and forced me to cancel the order.  We went to Roundtable in West Portal instead for about $20 cheaper.
author: Stan L.

description:
Hahaha. So, the last time I wrote about this place, I praised them because "we seem to get the hookup as far as quick and accurate service."

The last time I ordered from them - which will likely be the last time I order from them - they delivered the wrong meal - mixing up the mediterranean pasta dish for the sandwich. This has happened before and I was conscious to make clear that we wanted the sandwich, didn't happen. Not a big deal - bit annoying, but mistakes happen. But while they agreed to send over the right sandwich, they also called me back to demand the original dish back. Which I just don't understand, really, Maybe if it was to ensure that we weren't trying to double up on them, that's understandable - although a bit frustrating to be so doubted considering our history with the joint. But if that's not the reason, what is? Shudder to think. Anyway, since this wasn't the first error and was a really awkward experience, I've pretty much decided I'm done with the place. They still serve serviceable food and will deliver, but the appeal was always in the service - and when that fell off, they fell off my radar.
author: Ian M.

description:
wow. 

4 of us arrived here around 7 on a friday night. We sat down in the front booth. We're there for a minute or so and watch the busboy give menus to the table right next to us that had also just walked in. He then proceeded over to another table to clear it off and set it. Fine - he'll probably be over right after. Wrong. He then is sitting rolling silverware wrap ups. My friend had to get up out of his seat and walk the 5 steps he was away from us and ask for menus. He gets us 3. The waitress shows up 10 minutes later asking for drink orders. We order a pitcher of Pyramid....its flat. 

The rest of the evening continues in this manner. The pizza was good. But nobody came to clear our plates when we were done so we were left waiting for the waitress to come with our bill with 2 big trays on the table. We finally had to get up and go fetch the waitress to give us our bill. 

This place is getting 2 stars bc the pizza was decent and the prices were reasonable. Service was ATROCIOUS!
author: Megan M.

description: we got a hawaiian pizza. the pineapple had a weird taste to it, i am not quite sure what it was and it was in huge chunks :( the crust and ham were good. But i've def had better hawaiian pizza.
author: Olga S.

description: Came back again this september, I have to say, it was better than my last experience, I had a Calzone with canadian bacon, mozzarella, and tomato sauce. The crust was so good, and delicious in every way! Ofcourse this is where I discovered Anchorsteam, such a good beer! I wish they had it in Los Angeles
author: Antonio Z.

description: The decor is very east coast, family run pizza joint, so naturally it gets the thumbs up from this homesick girl. Get the thin crust, new yorker pizza with an 8 dollar pitcher of Bud and you're set!
author: Maria D.

description: I'm not a pizza lover but my husband and i wanted to try haystack since it is by our house, and it was really really good we ordered a peperoni pizza, i don't know about the rest of the food since i haven't tried anything else....
author: veronica n.

description: I havent eaten here that much. The pizza was really really oily which to me is kind of gross. Wasnt a huge fan of the sauce or the crust. Would eat here again if there wasnt a better option across the street
author: Carli M.

description: At 9pm, I felt a growl in my stomach.  I remembered some Yelpers mentioning Harvest has online ordering and stayed open late for Noe Valley.  I got online, ordered a personal spinach and artichoke pizza, got a called 2 minutes later, picked up the pizza pie 10 more minutes later, and ingested in under 5 min.  The pizza is pretty good, though doesn't compare to anything back east.  I'll definitely be hitting this place up again for the convenience factor.
author: Chris M.

description: We like garlic, and thank god....cause our pizza was very garlicky, and a little greasy.  But it was flavorful, and the place was comfortable.  We were thinking of giving it two stars (the service wasn't great), but admittedly...the pizza was tasty.  We got their house wine which wasn't great, but it was cheap, at least.  This place was ok.  Our experience was ok.  I wouldn't mind going back and giving it another chance.
author: Corey H.

description: I don't eat a lot of Pizza but when i do, I usually end up ordering from Haystack. The pizza is consistently good, with lots of options for toppings and combinations. Delivery is fast (usually 30-40 min) and the service is friendly. They store your address by referencing your phone number so repeat orders are a breeze.
author: Bumble B.

description: Pretty good.  Delivery seemed relatively prompt to the Duboce Triangle on a Wednesday night around dinnertime, and the Large Popeye (for $21.60) was tasty and covered with spinach and feta.  Some of the better pizza delivery I've had in the area.
author: Danny D.

description:
Just okay.  Nothing terrible happened, but the pizza was below average on taste.  It was missing something, oh yeah . . . taste.  

Service was mediocre - slow.   Prices a little high.   I wouldn't return.
author: K V.

description: Haystack's the only place I order pizza for delivery. I get a personal mushroom pizza, light on the cheese. They tend to put on a lot of cheese, so if you like that you're in luck.
author: Christy K.

description: mmmm  good Pizza--though the place makes me feel like I'm eating in the back of an east coast bar from the 1970s--but maybe that's the point.  Seems like most people takeout so it was pretty quiet except for the TV above the bar.  The one thing I like about their pizza was that it was not greasy at all compared to other pizzas I've had.   Their New Yorker is pretty good.   Plus you can order online which is kinda cool too...ah its amazing what you can do these days.
author: Ed C.

description: i called tonight and ordered a pizza and the guy who answered the phone and took my order  was nice  and i read him my card information and he repeated it back and he said it would  be an hour and then  at six  thirty three i called and some girl answered  and she was rude and she said the card was declined and  the food gives you the runs  bad enough to  be taken to the hospital and she argued with my husband and i guess if you arent liked they black list you  well i took my business else where and guess what the card worked fine
author: jessica e.

description:
I arrived late one night with two friends after we had been running round moving a couch - we were hungry and thirsty and there before us, like an oasis in the desert  was haystacks - we were seated despite it being after 10:30pm and our server was simply awesome, he rushed me a beer like I was in medical need and then was really great in helping us with deciding from their vast menu. I know we were famished as we ploughed through 2 large pizzas without a word being spoken but the food was awesome. Quite honestly its the best pizza ive had in SF - making up for mistakes like bambinos and north beach pizza 

im truly a fan
author: Stuart g.

description: I was highly disappointed with Haystack Pizza today.  I ordered 2-XL pizza for an office as a "thank you" gift two days ago.  I reconfirmed the order yesterday and today the pizza showed up 2 hours late dispite all efforts!  I will never order from there again.
author: Marleen C.

description: First they sent me a raw pizza. Then they sent me one where the sauce and cheese didn't meet the crust and the toppings were non-existent.  When I called to complain, the manager acted like a total jerk.  I told him, the customers who like your establishment tell 3 people.  The ones that don't post on Yelp.  I'm not touching that second pizza with a 10 foot pole.
author: Ruth W.

description: They have a really good ceaser salad and when you add grilled chicken, it's excellent.  a cute little place in noe valley, I'll have to try the pizza before i up it to 5 stars.
author: Caleb D.

description: Haystacks is just fine...not bad, not great but worth going and good enough to eat with a smile!
author: JR H.

description: Reminds me of my old college pizza place.  Reasonable pizza prices, good pitchers of beer and your favorite booth.  Open late-ish.  What more do you need?  The service is pretty good too.  I never order delivery as I live down the street but I hear it can take awhile.  Get the new yorker (just make sure whoever's with you is getting it too...garlic) or the pizza with feta, bacon and spinach on wheat crust (a T-street favorite).
author: Ann F.

description: The decor brings you back to a time gone by, and the food is not bad.  I actually like their pasta dishes more than their pizza, but that's neither here nor there.  This is a nice place for couples to bring their prospective date, since they could actually talk about the setting being from another era.  A good conversation starter in my opinion.  And the food has never turned my stomach, so I'm happy.
author: brenda b.

description: I've come to rely on Haystack for consistently good pizza and pasta. I've never been disappointed by the food. My only minor complaint is that at times, the table service can be a little more attentive.
author: Juan d.

description: Your run of the mill pizza joint with good ol' classic pizza.  No trendy thin crust or BBQ chicken pizza here.  Just old style, quality pizza - nothing special, but nothing to complain about either.   I like their Caesar salad, and we usually order a margherita or Mediterranean / Greek pizza.  The pizzas are big and filling.  The crust sometimes seems thick and doughy - not the greatest crust I've had.  But toppings are fresh and the traditional sauce is good.  We've eaten in the restaurant, and we've ordered take out as well.  The vibe in the restaurant is interesting - the waiter (also the owner??) is usually a middle-aged man wearing a black tux and dark glasses.  Are they trying to dress themselves up?  Not sure.  But either way, I feel comfortable in this ambiance, and I appreciate this place for what it is - a consistent, no frills pizza joint.  Much preferred over Goat Hill!  It's good, but it won't blow you away.  Next time I order pizza for delivery, it will definitely be a sausage and mushroom pizza from Haystacks.
author: Jenna C.

description: EWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW sorry i have to say ewwwww , i had it the first time it was bad , decided to give it another chance it was reallly bad  and a friend of mine insisted to order again poor guy didnt finish his food  , i will not give it a 4th chance even if it was freee no thnks
author: NAEL K.

description: Pizza was bad, service was good.  We didn't even come close to finishing our meal because it was so bad.  We also ordered the artichoke dip appetizer and it was terrible.   In fact, I was convinced it was going to make me sick because it smelled so bad.   Bottom line:  We are still looking for good pizza in Noe Valley.
author: Roberta J.

description: I love Haystack for their wings.  They're not your ordinary wings.  No sticky messy sauce, just spicy crispy battered wings with lots of meat!  The pizza is on par with West Coast pizza, but maybe not suitable for the distinguished palette of a Bostonian.  They deliver, but it's also a fun place to eat in.
author: Josiah B.

description: Just arrived back home from our first trip to Haystack & we were really impressed.  The atmosphere was nice and casual/comforable, service was excellent & so was the food.  We ordered a large Haystack combo pizza - it was one of the best pizza's I've had in a while and the whole table agreed.  Just the right amount of cheese and toppings, toppings were very fresh, sauce was excellent and tasty, just moist enough and perfectly cooked.  We ordered the house salads first and they were pricey at 5.50, but large enough to keep us choming until the pizza arrived - all in all a very pleasant suprise tonight - we will be back.
author: Bradford A.

description: Update -- while their menu was tasty and delivery convenient, I can't eat there anymore after they food poisoned me.  At least there is Noe Valley Pizza right next to it.
author: Sam B.

description: I really like this place for both dinning in and take-out/delivery.   They are fast, pizza is great and they are not too expensive.  I have yet to try their pasta because the ranch chicken sandwich they have is great as well as their minestrone soup but I will, one day, venture towards some of their other entrees.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I have been ordering from Haystack Pizza since the early 90's.  Most of the time the pizza has been really good with just the occasional "off" day.  I don't place orders very often any longer because I haved moved out of their delivery area (Miraloma) but I did try to call in an order to pick up the other day.  
I have never been treated so rudely before when trying to give someone  my business....I placed my order and then asked if I could  add Feta.  The "gentleman" taking my order SCREAMED profanity at me and then hung up.  I called back a few minutes later and asked for a manager and was denied. ???????

I can't even imagine how anyone could justify this behavior.  I might add that this was at 2:45pm on a weekday which I wouldn't think to be their busiest time.

NEVER EVER AGAIN will I make the mistake of patronizing Haystack.
author: esme m.

description: OK, I've only been in San Francisco for 3 months.  I tried to order online from Haystack pizza.  I reviewed their menu and site and placed my order.  Then I waited and waited and waited.  I finally got a call back an hour or more later saying they just got my order due to a fax jam.  They said I would get my order in about 20-30 minutes.  I said ok fine.  I get a call 5 minutes later saying that they don't deliver to my address.  I said well Im in one of the zip codes listed on their web site.  They then say well Im beyond the 16th Street limit.  Well it would have been nice to have been told this on their site first off and secondly when they called the first time.  Needless to say, I will not be going to their establishment.  Update your website to reflect your true delivery area, otherwise you will lose more customers like myself.
author: Louis B.

description:
I had a decent late lunch with a laid-back middle-aged waitress. OK, I said, pizza is not soggy, nothing too special. 

But a few weeks later I went there for dinner in a group of six - and it was TERRIBLE! 

The waitresses were both very young (underage?) and rarely came to our table, and when they did, barely heard anything we requested. The table was not really big enough for six, but they did nothing to put smaller tables together or otherwise accomodate us. The waitress who set our table (with paper mat, fork, knife and napkin) literally put a table set ON THE MIDDLE OF THE TABLE. Did she expect one of us to get on top of the table and eat from the center? And she put an extra set right on top of another set. I told the waitress we didn't need this set, and she just smiled and walked away, obviously not interested in anything I, her customer, was saying. 

I had to go to the counter to order drinks, when a waitress appeared, looking pissed off, and told me to go back to my table. I went back, thinking she was going to take our drink order, but she didn't appear for another 15 minutes at our table. After a while we managed to put in our drink and food order, but got so little attention, it was clear these waitresses were either totally untrained or didn't care at all. When they brought in the pizza which took up the entire table, they didn't bother to clear away the salad bowl or plates - so we had to start discarding them on a nearby shelf/wall ledge ourselves. I mean, really. I haven't had service this bad in a long time.

I don't really understand how Haystack uses inexperienced staff during their prime hours (this was Thursday evening). I know they've been in the neighborhood for a long time. Is this the owner's way of saying: "We don't really care what you think of us, I'm minimizing labor costs with cheap inexperienced labor that I'm doing nothing to train them, and you can just go to the pizza joint across the street, because I don't really need your business anyway." 

Well, this is one local living in the neighborhood who will not be going to this pizza restaurant anytime soon. 

What's funny is, I grew up in the neighborhood, and I remember distinctly in 1985 going there in a group, and the waitress who served us was surly and unhelpful, too. Does the owner or manager just uniformly treat the workers there like crap, or something? Is that the "Haystack tradition"?
author: Randy D.

description:
Poor service for sub-par pizza. 

Their website allows online ordering, but please save yourself the headache and pick-up the phone. Having to hold down the CTRL key on my keyboard to select multiple toppings for my pizza would have been fine in the late 90's, but nowadays c'mon. 

The pizza is extra greasy which makes for a quick exit in the morning. 

If you look at their website for their delivery service area, make sure you consider that the delivery guy may be having a bad night and might not want to drive out to your house. IS your zipcode listed in the delivery service area? You just might call to find out that even though your zipcode is in their service area, you're just a little too far for their guy to drive. 

This place is pathetic. Greasy pizza and sub-par cheese quality. 

Get in your car and goto Little Star. You deserve a lot better than Haystack barn pizza.
author: John D.

description: This place definitely has great pizza ....but the best thing I've ever had here is not pizza, but their hamburger, which is to die for. No preformed packaged patties here, the burger was melt in your mouth delicious with all the trimmings and wedge fries. Yummy!
author: Suepattra M.

description: HayStack Pizza is the most heavenly Pizza around SF.  The business is family owned and they are the warmest people I ever met in a pizza place.  Not to mention the delicious most addicting pizza... I recommend the delightful Zorba with loads of feta cheese, sausage, mushrooms, bacon and onions and bellpeppers. Or the just try the Haystack.  You can order online and they deliver with a smile usually within 30-45 min.  Well worth my time anyday!!!!  TRY HAYSTACK PIZZA SOON!! Let me know how you like it!!!
author: Jacob K.

description: Ahhhh it's a shame because I really like the people at Haystack, and I have really tried to like the pizza here because it is my neighborhood joint, but every time I try, I fail. The pizza is just kind of "blah" the crust is too thick for me (even the thin crust) and it is generally soggy and greasy. Salads seem out of the bag and prices on everything are too high in my opinion. I wouldn't avoid it like the plague, but if you have the option, go somewhere else.
author: Tara T.

description: Good, solid, dependable food in a restaurant with a comfy 1970's rec-room atmosphere.  I stopped in for lunch alone one weekday afternoon and they seemed both surprised and delighted that I wanted to eat there. Quite nostalgia-inducing.
author: Jude F.

description: Online ordering is pretty sweet... but my Popeye pizza was just kind of gross.  I think I prefer Extreme Pizza over this... and as we know, Extreme isn't that great to begin with.  But at least your pizza doesn't come from them bathed in grease.
author: Nat K.

description:
Haystack is Noe Valley's best bang-for-your-buck when it comes to pizza.  I used to chow down here on a weekly basis when my last ladyfriend and I were finished  imbibing for the night.  We'd be hungry, buzzed,  and looking for a  late-night place to stuff our stomachs to near capacity.  Whenever we were in this mood, Haystack always fit the bill with a quiet dining area, quick and polite servers, and a humble pizza-parlor like vibe that's accented with just the right amount of tablecloth-and-napkin dignity.

When I'm sans-date, I always order a 3-item small and walk over to pick it up. It's usually ready when I get there, but a small bar makes for a great spot to chill with a beer when I've jumped the gun and showed up early.  When I'm with the lady-friend we usually dine on-premises, splitting a small "Old Macdonald" pizza with a house salad while washing it down with a carafe of cheap wine.  The pizza's thicker than normal, the toppings are generous, but the crust is a bit on the chewy side.  The house wine is pretty decent, and the always-fresh Salad is one of the more rockin' deals on 24th Street. We've ordered "Luigi the Italian" with Pesto and Garlic, and it's been pretty good too.  The regular combination is an excellent crowd-pleaser, and those who pine for pizza from the East Coast  will appreciate the "Native New Yorker", a  thin-crust specialty with a tomato-basil sauce and devoid of toppings. 

Two tables near the windows give a view out onto 24th Street.  If you're in a big group, large oval-shaped booths with cushy upholstery make for a great gather-around seating arrangement.  And while the front room rarely fills up, a larger area towards the back is available for overflow seating, banquets, or private parties.

If you search San Francisco far and wide, you'll undoubtedly find a better pizza.  And if you're willing to brave the drive, the line, and the wait at Zachary's or Little Star, be my guest.  In the mean time, I'll be walking through the front door of Haystack and sliding into my favorite table.  Not long thereafter, I'll have a menu in one hand, and my beverage of choice in the other...
author: Mike W.

description:
when i want some pizza delivered, i call this place... i've never actually been to the restaurant and dined though... so i hope it's a clean place that values good hygiene...
anyway, their veggie pizzas are good... i like artichokes...
meat pizzas are tasty too...
i like their thick crusts...
author: charlotte s.

description: Suggest pizza to me any time and chances are, I'm up for it. I just love pizza.     Since moving to San Francisco, pizza has become quite a staple for me: it's relatively cheap and it's convenient since most pizza joints deliver. Yet despite my affinity for pizza, I recognize that not all pizzas are created equal. Once in a great while, a really special pizza place comes along and really shines all above the rest. THE pizza place in SF is Haystack Pizza.  Read more here: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=31
author: Baochi N.

description: Oh man, so good.  I came here with a group of 25 and we all had really good pizza and beer.  It's a tad dough-y, and I never saw a check, but I'd definitely come back here.
author: Cody G.

description:
This is a pretty bodacious spot to get some pizza, not only do they use feta cheese on their pizza, I mean how crazy and delicious is that, but their XL pizza is called a freaking Wagon Wheel!! That alone should be reason enough to come here every night for pizza! 

But be careful, there are some items you dont really want to get off the menu, like.....


like,

like NOTHING!
Everything is pretty bomb here, but the pizza is the most bada** item of all.

In all seriousness here people, Haystack Pizza is a fine establishment of very hard working people who want to give you delicious food at a affordable price.

They should be in Hayward too though seeing as their name is haystack.
author: Dale E.

description: What you see is what you get! Simple and old fashion San Francisco fare. No, this will probably not be on any of the Food Network shows, but the food is good, moderately priced and delivery is quick! Love the minestrone and anti-pasto with their creamy Italian dressing.  The owner walks around to check that everything is ok. Nice.  On a recent delivery, they left out the mozzarella on the salad. I made a call to let them know and the delivery person was at my door within 5min with a container of full of mozzarella. Great customer service!
author: Queenie O.

description: gotta try their pesto thin crust.  Yummmmm!!!
author: Sydney L.

description: Stepping into Haystack Pizza is like stepping back into time into the 1970s, or at least like traveling to a landlocked state, what with its 1970s Western/cowboy decor. My dining companion and I had the medium New Yorker pizza for $12. Described by the menu as "thin crust with cheese, garlic, and oregano," it was wet yet chewy, and very enjoyable. I haven't had pizza like that since the 1980s brought us "wood-fired." With a $10 half bottle of wine, it was a cheap fun dinner.
author: Amy E.

description: The place I usually order pizza from. Favorites: The Alexander and The New Yorker. Good stuff. Thank you.
author: Zell C.

description: Haystack, you make me fat.  But I still love you.  This place delivers the tastiest pizzas super fast.  Chewy, not too thick crust, lots and lots of fresh toppings, and loads of stretchy cheese.  What's not to love?
author: Helen C.

description: Convenient online ordering, and since it's in my 'hood I get super quick delivery service. The Mediteranean was a yummy garlicy veggie choice with a somewhat doughy medium thick crust (though I'm much more of a thin crust type). This place'll do in a pinch for my pizza cravings. Maybe I'll try one of their huge salads next time.
author: Rachel R.

description: Had a killer pinapple and ham pizza there tonight.  The service was alright, albeit a little slow with the refills on the water, which is the only thing that keeps it from gettin that last star.  It had that neighborhood hideaway feel that I miss living out in the 'burbs.  The friend that brought us there is a Noe Valley local and swears by this place, and I have to agree, they make a mean pizza.
author: Jennifer D.

description: This is a great little pizza place in the heart of Noe. You can go with a large group and sit in a booth or go as a couple.  The staff is sweet and helpful.  You can get wheat dough if you like and pick from a variety of toppings.  Overall it was a yummy place to spend a Sunday afternoon.
author: Anita T.

description: I've been a customer for a long time. Lately, most orders have been delivery, and we've ordered pizza and salad almost religiously since moving to a not-so-hard-to-find apartment on the east slope of Twin Peaks. The guys from the Chinese restaurant can find us with no problem but the delivery guys from Haystack are often dolts. One chubby Hispanic guy has been downright rude and insulting. So if your place does not involve multiple units and an elevator, try someone else. Or, eat at the restaurant. The food is worth it.
author: Lucas M.

description: Hella Good!!!  Zorba the Greek is my favorite, and my friend says the pineapple and ham (Hawaiian style) is the best in the city.  The ambiance is nothing special, but the pizza can't be beat.
author: Marc C.

description: When i feel like getting a pizza, I would order from Haystack and do a "pick-up". This way I know it's straight out of the oven and hot (I'm right around the corner from them). I've been getting pizza from them ever since they open. They are one of my favorite pizza place in S.F.
author: Steven J.

description: We ordered $65 worth of food on Monday night and the food was dull and unseasoned. We thought we'd try their pastas and soup. I feel like they need some cooking lessons as I could have made better food than the stuff we got. I am also going to call today to let them know my thoughts. We will never order from this place.
author: Leeshawn N.

description:
um .. tastes like Straw Hat pizza?   

Thumbs UP:  Delivery service and it is open late (for Noe Valley) 
Thumbs DOWN:  Haystack needs to consider that pizza may have evolved in the past 30 years.
author: Jeff C.

description: I haven't found an AMAZING pizza place in the city yet.  However, Haystack is as good as it gets for me.  They deliver to our house.  They are quick.  They are good.  I really like their pizza.
author: Eric S.

description:
We weren't feeling going out. So we ordered Haystack and I have to say I love that crust to death. It's good and thick and crunchy like a baguette. I like that the sundried tomatoes weren't oil-soaked.

Yuppie pizza, Heather called it. I'm not sure why.  Was she referring to the advent of sundried tomatoes as the gourmet ingedient du jour in the 90s? Wouldn't that be retro yuppie pizza?
author: Debbie K.

description:
worst pizza I ever had, order a thin crust which should been called no crust. No flavor, I think I could make a better pizza with a microwave. 

the prices online aren't the same as the price at the restaurant. 

The people there are slow, how long does it take to get a bill!!! Do you want to get paid or what. 

Would not recommend to anyone.
author: chieh h.

description: I've been going to Haystack since I was a kid and they still have the same red curly-haired waitress that used to serve us when I ate there with my family.  They renovated this place a few years back but for the most part it's the same old place.  I love Haystack's pizza but they also make a great meat lasagna.  I prefer to eat in at Haystack rather than get delivery.
author: Timmy C.

description: Got delivery from here.  Won't comment on the time it took, since we called on a hot Friday night at 8pm.  I imagine they were really busy at this time.  We got the New Yorker, which is a Thin crust with cheese, garlic & oregano and The Joly Green Giant, which has Broccoli, zucchini, fresh garlic, onions, mushrooms & tomatoes.  Both were good, but the New Yorker was our favorite.  It was really good pizza, and we will be ordering from here again!
author: Pele N.

description:
yay for online ordering. 

however, my pizza came with a receipt that included my address and FULL CREDIT CARD NUMBER. thanks, haystack, for giving someone all the information they need to rip me off. much appreciated and unbelievable. if I could leave a zero star review I would.

won't be ordering from this place again.
author: Jen B.

description: I never tire of Haystack's Alexander pizza.  No better way to recover from a hangover.
author: P-Rock F.

description: If there is a place in the city that I love but don't get to enough it is Noe Valley. It is so charming and full of tiny little boutique shops. Now I am not sure if my review of Haystack is completely legit because I have not actually had the pizza here but I have heard it is decent. What my boyfriend did introduce me to here is the sauce-less buffalo wings. They still have the same kick as good buffalo wings however they are not as tangy...I love the tang! They are great because you don't go through 42 napkins as your eating. If you eat in you get to enjoy the eclectic saloon ambiance.
author: Sugey G.

description:
One of the best places for a pizza when you're looking for something more than just bread a cheese.

We love this place.  The "Cleopatra" with eggplant, sundried tomatoes, and feta is a favorite as well as the "Haystack" which has everything on it!

Family owned, family operated.  Great local joint.

Good for dine-in and delivery.
author: Liz T.

description:
It's good.
It's convenient.
It's fast.
It's not expensive.

L.

PS: try the cleopatra  ;-)
author: Lewis G.

description: I love pizza.  If pizza was "good for you" I would eat it every day.   Unfortunattely, it is not at all "good for you" and therefore I do not eat it very often.  So, when I DO order pizza, its a bit of an event.  Despite the glowing reviews, I was NOT very happy with this pizza.  It took over an hour and there was practically no sauce.  The topping were good but crust was chewy and we didn't eat what didn't have toppings on it.   The crust made the leftovers nearly impossible to eat. Maybe it would have been better with extra sauce?  But for the price (not cheap!) and the lack of service and the chewy crust--I'm going to try someplace else next time.
author: Adrienne G.

description: I haven't written a review on here in over two years but I was very compelled recently to write a review in regards to the "hot garbage" recently that over delivered to my house.  Haystack has really got down hill and it's a bummer. Been eating there for over five years.  I ordered my usual thin crust pepperoni on the late night, as they, " used to" have this pizza in order.  I recieved the pizza and there were a total of five pieces of pepperoni on it and the dought was soggy and wet, literally.  Wow, now that is bonified disgusting.  I called them back to complain regarding what I did not order and they proceeded to tell me I didn't order this pizza and was wrong.  When I questioned this, I offered to show my receipt and was insulted by, "Dino". This guy is a real piece of work to say the least and he supposedly runs things there.  Wow.  Don't go there.  If you're paying premium sf prices, you should get a beyond decent pizza right? anyway, fuck that place, guess I'll just order dominoe's next time, haha.
author: Zach H.

description: GREAT pizza, especially with the whole wheat crust.  I like the topping selection, though they could have some more authentic italian toppings like proscutto and pancetta.  I don't know how the delivery service is, since I am just a couple blocks away.  The bottom line is, the whole wheat crust really make a huge difference and Haystack is our go to pizza place.
author: Ken H.

description:
i LOVE this place,
 partly couse i grew up on this in noe valley, mostly couse its amazing pizza.

I kinda have a pizza fetish, and when I try new places i get the same combo( pep, mush, olives)(dont bite!) just to see if the place i try makes that combo as good as the one i get at haystack!
author: rae m.

description: This place totally exceeded my expectations. Was expecting an old school, minimal option pizza joint, and while it was old school, I was very impressed with the customization. Plenty of veggies to choose from, and the mini size was just right not to feel like you're overdoing it, but still filling when partnered with a salad. Like Matt W. wrote, the topping did feel generous. I wish the wheat crust was offered on the mini, but that's the only negative. Service was super friendly.
author: Jason B.

description: I've never been to Haystack but get delivery from them pretty often. I usually go for the calzone and it's always good and delivery is always fast .
author: Travis V.

description: I order delivery from here all the time.  They'll make a thin-crust that's not so far from New York style pizza that I really miss.  I've walked by the place and it seems like it has a fun, pizza-parlor kind of atmosphere.  The kind of place you'd take your kid's little league team after they won a big game.
author: Jimmy C.

description: decent pizza. it was good enough to satisfy my pizza craving but i can't say i'd purposely go back. it probably didn't help that they were playing honky tonk country music in the back room.
author: Regina C.

description: Another awesome Friday night with great movies and great FOOD!  Haystack is the best pizza and has really prompt delivery - which does not always happen in SF!  Their customer service is rock solid and again - the pizza is great; esp. with extra sauce!!!!
author: Craig L.

description: i ordered pizza to go a few times when i first moved to noe valley.  each time the pizza was the same:  pretty garlicky and tasty but absolutely DRENCHED in oil.  like a puddle of oily water in the middle of the pizza.  it was ok the first time when i was drunk, kind of gross the second time when i wasn't drunk and thought maybe it was a fluke, and totally yucky the third time when i realized that, that's just how they make their pizza.  i think i'll stick to escape from NY.
author: Natalie H.

description: Popeye The Sailor pizza (pesto, spinach, onions & feta) = Delicious!! I always get delivery so I can't rate the service.
author: Laura B.

description: Haystack ain't fancy, but it certainly has its place in our dining circuit.  Sometimes, you know, you just want an inexpensive, uncomplicated pizza-- the kind you might have scarfed down beside the neighborhood pool as a kid in the 'burbs.  This is that kind of comfort food.  I can't speak for the rest of their menu, but the salads are fine and the pizza has a pleasing cheese-sauce-crust ratio.
author: Emily D.

description:
99% of my visits to haystack are for take-out.  consistently great traditional italian fare (it's no gialina's), haystack has become my go-to spot when i gotta get some 'za. in particular the popeye pizza (spinach, feta, etc..) is sooo good!! and i usually order a side of fries (incidentally- best restaurant fries in town!!) which i am unable to do at the pizza place closest to my house.

the service and pricing are fair.  parking in the neighborhood can be rough but unless there's some kind of extreme circumstance, added delivery time (and resulting impact to the food) rarely justifies the service! the ambience of the in house dining is not my favorite- somewhat dimly lit and 'old' (looks and feels almost exactly the same as it did when i ate here as a young man 20+ years ago!).
author: Jay J.

description: I've been going to this place for years. LOVE IT!! One of the best pizza places I've ever been to, its definitely a must. Every time I'm back in the city I have to make a stop for pizza and fried raviolli, or lasagna and garlic cheese bread. Service is great, food is wonderful, its clean, and if you're into people watching the window seats are fab. if you're in the are give it a try. I'm sure you'll love it too.
author: Tati C.

description: if you're ever in a group or family situation where everyone is arguing over what style of pizza they want for dinner, i suggest you take them to haystack. it should suffice most, if not all, of the group or family members. haystack has been serving good old family style pizza for over 30 years. so they clearly know what they're doing. my favorite is #3 (haystack combo). it's fabulous and quite comforting. kinda like family can be sometimes... while you're waiting for the pizza, be sure to check out the native american and western inspired decor. you almost want to change your name to "howling wind" or something.
author: frisco j.

description: One of the best neighborhood pizza delivery places. Their pizzas have great toppings and crust and for those of you in the mood for something else there are plenty of other options.  Those that dine in will find the place very comfortable and laid back.  The service is courteous and prompt wether sitting down, picking up or getting delivery.
author: B B.

description: what's up with the decor here? i just went there last night because it was the only thing open at 10:30pm...but judging by all the reviews, i think delivery is the way to go at this place. the meatball sandwich i had was pretty good, but nothing to rave about. i think i might try delivery next time.
author: eve l.

description: decent pizza and other dishes. the service is good, i've had times when it was slow but with a beer and a game on the tv it was fine. request a chicken pizza with only pesto (no tomato sauce) and its money...
author: Katie M.

description: my gf used to go here alot in the past and then stopped.  on a whim she decided it was a good night for pizza and since i love pizza, who am i to complain.  she suggested Haystack because they have wheat pizza crusts.  we ordered the Zorba the Great or Greek..  but we changed the toppings. we decided to substitute the bell peppers and onions for eggplant and spinach.  the pizza was really good for a wheat pizza.  the only other pizza place you can get wheat is at Blondies that we know of.  the only problem we had was with the service. it takes them quite a bit of time to remember to refill your drinks or give you a check.  other than that, i recommend Zorba the Great with Wheat Crust.
author: ed c.

description: i think this place makes pretty good pizza. i like the thinner kind of pizza, which is yummies. i almost remember that the pesto here isn't bad either. I like that it isn't too greasy, and not too expensive either. the people that work here are usually pretty nice. it's a very cozy, what i think may be family owned place, or at least it seems that way. i came here a few times with friends and family, all in all everyone was pretty satisfied. although, i do recall trying to get a job there, and never getting a call back  -_-
author: Casey Z.

description: All dough and no flavor.  More like a bagel than a pizza.  I don't know why it is so hard for Noe Valley to have good pizza.
author: Zack S.

description: This place has definitely gone downhill. Must be the economy but they now charge for bread, plus their soda glasses have shrunk to the size of a water glass. Those water size sodas will now cost you $2.50. Food is still good but the service has gone downhill too. I'm not sure if it is a shortage of staff but the service is too slooooow.
author: Benzee B.

description: Actually 4.5 stars -- four stars for the in-house experience; five stars for the pizza. I didn't have a bad experience eating at Haystack. Chicken sandwich was OK (not great) and the service was fine. But the story here is the pizza. Can't even try a second kind because we hit the jackpot right off the bat (cheese pizza, no sauce, with ricotta). Amazing! Best pizza in Noe Valley.
author: andrea a.

description:
just ok.

the service was by far the biggest issue.   my waiter was not friendly and hardly responded when asked questions.  i got an entree with sauce on the side.  the sauce came ice cold in a cup that was cold (so the waiter had to know this).  i had to find the waiter to ask for it to be heated up, for which i got a groan.  15 seconds later he is back~~as you can imagine not heated at all--still ice cold.  i gave up on the sauce at that point.  

my drink came with tarter/cocktail sauce all over it.  kind of sloppy and gross.

the food was pretty decent which is why i gave 3 starts.  would i go back, potentially, would i rush back...no.
author: n. h.

description:
pizza was pretty good. 

took a while 


and the service was a little eh... 

at one point the people working there started seriously arguing fairly loud infront of everyone. 



but its pizza, i dont expect much. 

i liked it .. .however my friend spent the rest of the night in the bathroom..


beware of mushrooms maybe.
author: R M.

description: This is a good local pizza place. It's nothing to write home about though.
author: Andy F.

description: Great pizza, great salad, good service...the owner makes you feel welcome. Inexpensive...homemade sausage...yum...the negative reviews are unfounded...their pizza tastes belong to pizza hut, round table, and domino's...
author: SFNATIVE K.

description: Pizza was just okay.  The calamari was awesome though!  Very unexpected.  The caesar salad was a little better than just okay.  Prices are good.  Service was pretty good.  All in all, it was an okay place to go if you're in the neighborhood and don't feel like walking over to 29th for Front Porch.
author: Jo M.
